l1f.name: Sister avenges her lover
l1f.description: A young woman turns into monster and kills her brothers avenging the death of her husband or lover

j49.name: Moon’s wife cannot follow him
j49.description: The Moon's wife or sister tries to follow him to the sky but is unable to do it

i131.name: The thread of life
i131.description: Life of every man is related to certain thread. When the thread is cut, the man dies

m39b.name: Fool attacks his own dwelling
m39b.description: Person does not put attention to which direction his canoe goes. As a result he returns to his own dwelling, attack its inhabitants killing his own kin

l96a.name: Oh, dear!
l96a.description: When person sighs or utters an interjection, another one (usually a demon) emerges because his name is spelled like Ahh, Ohhoi, etc.

f30.name: Snake paramour
f30.description: Woman or girl takes eel, snake, lizard, or worm for paramour. People kill or badly injure the paramour, the woman and/or her progeny or the woman herself is transformed into snake

l115.name: Perfect gentleman
l115.description: A girl who rejected suitors finds at last a really handsome man. He escorts her to his place and distributes on the way all his clothes and body parts that he loaned before. Only his skull (head) remains

i61.name: Milk on the Milky Way
i61.description: Milky Way is a trace of spilled milk

f96.name: Ugly man becomes handsome
f96.description: A girl rejects an ugly youth, men also do not like him. A powerful supernatural makes him handsome while those who were evil to him are punished

b104.name: Chicken turns into tortoise
b104.description: When a guest comes, a host hides from him a cooked chicken. When the host is going to eat it himself, he finds the chicken transformed into the tortoise (origin of tortoises) or a toad

k112.name: Farm-hand revenges on the Sun
k112.description: A poor man condemns the Sun and other supernatural personages responsible for weather, wild animals, etc. that because of them he lost his property. He finds them and punishes them

e31b.name: Rescuers of a man
e31b.description: Several women take part in the reanimation of a dead man. They argue whose role was crucial and/or who of them should be the spouse of the reanimated person

k16.name: Girl’s pet turns into a young man
k16.description: Disguised as a bird, small animal or insect, the hero lets himself be caught by a girl to have sex with her or to steal valuables possessed by her family or he lets himself be caught by the girl's father to receive opportunity to get to his daughter

m61a3.name: Person provokes a quarrel between two fish
m61a3.description: To provoke a quarrel between two different fish, person tells each one that the other was insulting him

a32i.name: A shepherd in the moon
a32i.description: A shepherd or herdsman (alone or with a girl, with his herd, dogs) is seen in the moon

l99.name: Bring me a spit to roast you!
l99.description: An ogre sends a man to bring a spit and/or firewood to cook him. The man intentionally does it slowly, brings unfit objects or a an animal helps him to escape

k2.name: The destroyed ladder
k2.description: Hero climbs up (e.g. to a tree) or down (e.g. into a deep cave) by ladder, rope, from branch to branch, etc. The rope etc. breaks or is intentionally destroyed and the hero cannot return to the ground. (all cases of motif K2A are also computed together with K2)

i63.name: Milky Way is a path of tapir
i63.description: Milky Way is a path of tapir, or tapir is seen in the Milky Way

k129.name: The disenchanted beauty
k129.description: Because of the female antagonist, a girl faints and is taken for dead but her body is not decomposed. A valuable marriage partner breaks the charms, she revives

m168.name: More cowardly than the hare
m168.description: The hare is in despair because he is afraid of all creatures but is delighted when he sees other animals (sheep, frogs, dusks) being afraid of him

k32f.name: Bird-son rescues his adopted mother
k32f.description: An evil spirit abandons a girl or a young woman in a tree or islet. She takes care for a nestling of bird of prey, he grows big, rescues her

m3.name: Chain of animals
m3.description: Person crosses a water or air space along the chain of many animals, birds or fish

l40b.name: Absurd actions to lure person out
l40b.description: Somebody acts in absurd way to lure person out of his or her place. The person does not understand the deception and comes to explain how to act correctly

k79.name: Snake serves an example of resuscitation
k79.description: Person in a desperate situation gets to see how a snake or other small animal uses remedy to revive or to cure itself or other animals. The person uses the remedy, succeeds

d13hh.name: Not to laugh visiting the dead
d13hh.description: Person who visits the other world should not laugh or demonstrate his surprise seeing strange and funny things

l81b.name: Hero’s cut off legs
l81b.description: Hero’s companions put a sword (sabre etc.) in front of his tent or room. When the hero runs out in a hurry, he is woonded by the blade (usually his legs are cut off).

b26.name: Man joins wild animals
b26.description: Person who follows the wild animals turns into one of them or into their master

k27e.name: Ordeal: to eat much
k27e.description: An ordeal: to eat or drink much or eat or drink poisonous beverage or food

k98.name: Animal turns into household
k98.description: An animal or (rare) a person that gave birth to the hero or supported him for a long time asks his master to kill him. Its remains turn into a house with a household where the hero can live

c6h.name: An insect brings the earth
c6h.description: An insect brings the earth (from under the water, from a lower world or from a far-away place)

j34.name: Frightened grandmother
j34.description: After killing their enemy, heroes have fun frightening their (grand)mother or father with its dummy

m123b.name: Trickster tied to a boat
m123b.description: A man gets a woman thanks to a trick, carries her away in his canoe. She asks permission to go to shore to relieve herself, runs away

k15c.name: Clothes of stone
k15c.description: The owner of the stone (ice) clothes kills people. The hero hides his stone clothes and kills him

c10.name: The flood: the wet tails
c10.description: During the flood birds or animals escape to some place (mountain, tree, boat, sky). Tips of their tails or other body parts get covered with water or foam and acquire their present color and form

k8a.name: Jonah: swallowed by monster
k8a.description: Person gets into the belly of water being or into the belly of giant creature which appearance and living place remain vague. He kills the monster from the inside and/or returns to earth by himself (i.e. not extracted by other people)

h6b.name: The life-medicine spilled on plants
h6b.description: The life-medicine is accidentally spilled not on men but on plants which become evergreen, capable for regeneration or producing fruits

i38a.name: The dog-husbands
i38a.description: Dogs or dog-headed men are husbands of human women

j40.name: Enemy from the sky
j40.description: A dangerous being who lives in the sky carries away a person or many people (or person's cut off head or limb). A young kin of the perished one revenges on the dangerous being and/or brings back the victim (his or her head, etc.)

l85b.name: Woman gives birth to disfigured child
l85b.description: A woman gives birth to disfigured child because she offended a powerful supernatural being (Rain, Sun, etc.). Her child is provided with magic power and eventually obtains normal body

k115.name: A web at the entrance
k115.description: A man escapes from his (her, theirs) pursuers and hides in a cave. A spider spins its web over the hiding place. When the pursuers see the spider web they think the cave is unoccupied and do not enter it

m159.name: The lion’s share
m159.description: The strongest predator (usually a lion) and two other animals hunt together. One shares the booty and is killed or badly injured by the strongest one. When the third one becomes to share, he gives everything to the strongest one and explains that the injured one taught him the right way of sharing

m84.name: Revived from bones
m84.description: Person, animal or (rare) a fruit is eaten up. After this all bones (all seeds) are put together and the eaten up is revived

b57.name: Blood reddens world
b57.description: When some person or animal is killed, blood paints the sky or vegetation (origin of the sunrise or sunset, of reddish colors of Aurora borealis or of the red color of the autumn leaves)

c25a.name: Cooking soup in the Moon
c25a.description: The destiny of creation depends on a person (usually an old woman) who is cooking soup somewhere outside of our world (in the sky, in the Moon, etc.)

g5.name: Food tree
g5.description: Fruits and shoots of different cultivated plants grow on the branches of one tree or certain plant has a tree form that is alien to it in nature

f29.name: Girl sits on the ground
f29.description: A girl or young woman who is usually occupied with domestic work (is cooking, weaving, etc.) sits on the ground and copulates with a penis-like creature that crawls from below into her vagina

l120.name: Snake-women turn into apple-trees
l120.description: Hero listens in conversation of demonic beings who plan to turn into something edible, attractive, etc. and to destroy those who touch them. The hero neutralize the demons beforehand

f9f2.name: Hood of cobra in wife’s bag
f9f2.description: Woman’s snake paramour is killed. She puts part of his body into her bag and gets a right to kill her husband if he woulod not guess what is inside. At the last moment the husband gets to know the secret and kills the woman

b1b.name: Two female creators
b1b.description: In the beginning of times two supernatural females compete in producing things. One has positive, another negative characteristics

a22d.name: The burned up persons turn into constellation
a22d.description: The burned up persons turn into a constellation or into the dark spot on the Milky Way

k27r.name: света
k27r.description: To visit the world of the dead

l42g.name: Hansel and Gretel
l42g.description: A man (persuaded by his wife) abandons his children (usually a son and a daughter of his former wife who had died) in the wilderness. The children (or at least one of them) survive and become successful

j19b.name: Belly burned through
j19b.description: An evil spirit kills a woman burning her belly through

k18b.name: To cease crying
k18b.description: A baby boy has to recognize his father or mother among many people. When his parent takes him, the boy ceases crying

i130.name: The sky net
i130.description: Orion, the Pleiades, Ursa Major or Ursa Minor is a hunting or fishing net

j13.name: Two sisters
j13.description: Two sisters (if more, only two play a significant role in the plot) travel and meet an unpleasant suitor or get to an ogre

j16.name: Rejects to eat insects
j16.description: Person perishes because being forced to clean ogre's or animal’s head infected with insects, refuses to bite the insects, spits in disgust or is suspected to do it

i44.name: Chthonic serpent
i44.description: Giant serpent lies on the perimeter of the earth or supports the earth

a43.name: The Moon in one moccasin
a43.description: The Moon-person runs out of the lodge and flies up. He forgets to put his footwear on one foot, or somebody attempts to seize him grasping his foot or cuts the foot off. Now the Moon-person lacks one foot or footwear on one of his (or her) feet

g13b.name: People ate fungi
g13b.description: Before acquisition of cultivated plants people ate fungi

i47.name: Rainbow is filth
i47.description: Rainbow is a flatulence of a demon, a spray of a skunk, is associated with spit, urine, feces, genitals, etc., causes skin diseases

i58.name: Milky Way is the way of birds
i58.description: Milky Way is the path of migratory birds (especially wild geese)

m56a.name: Alligator’s secret
m56a.description: A man or an animal beats alligator but it remains unharmed and says that he would be killed if stricken in one special place on his body. The next time the same person strikes alligator this way and kills it

m16a.name: Diving bird’s medicine
m16a.description: A supernatural helper (usually a loon) makes a blind man to regain his eyesight diving with him into water

k34.name: Fatal swing
k34.description: Person kills others inviting them to sit on a swing and launching them into water, on rocks, etc.

m21.name: A protector hides fugitives
m21.description: Person is pursued by an enemy. A man or an animal hides him on his own body or nearby

i46c.name: Rainbow rope
i46c.description: Rainbow is a rope to which a domestic animal is tied

m8c.name: The stuck up eyes
m8c.description: Birds peck through a layer of clay, wax, pitch etc. with which person’s eyes or anus are stuck up

l13.name: Reared up monster
l13.description: A small creature is found and reared up by people. When it is grown up, it becomes harmful and dangerous

h34b.name: Rivers flow in both directions
h34b.description: Rivers were flowing or according to the original plan had to flow in both directions; somewhere there is a river that flows in both directions

k89b.name: Brother abandoned in a tree
k89b.description: A girl becomes separated with her brothers (or brother) who die, remain in a tree, on a hill, ascend to the sky, etc. After being happily married, the girl once again meets her brothers who have acquired a non-human nature

k85.name: Horses-brothers
k85.description: An antagonist possesses a horse which can overtake any other. Hero obtains the brother (sister) of this horse who is the only one to win the race with the antagonist's horse

a21.name: Luminaries thrown up into the sky
a21.description: The sun and/or the moon are inanimate objects thrown up or put into the sky

b42t.name: Ursa major is a big mammal
b42t.description: Seven main stars of Ursa major are interpreted as a figure of a mammal: bear, deer, mountain sheep, camel, dog

m127a.name: The quail makes the fox laugh
m127a.description: Trickster animal asks a bird to make him laugh. The bird sits on the head of a woman (child, cow, etc.), other person tries to kill the bird, hits the wife (breaks cow's horn, etc.). Or the bird distracts person attention to let the trickster steal the person’s food

l44b.name: The blind got his sight, the lame got his legs
l44b.description: A blind man and a lame man live together and help each other. When they got mortally scared or became to fight, their eyes and legs were cured

m29b.name: Trickster-fox, jackal or coyote
m29b.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is fox, jackal or coyote

m29r.name: Trickster is a porcupine
m29r.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a porcupine

m62b.name: Trying to hit the hero hit each other
m62b.description: Two or more personages direct their weapons against the hero who is between them but hit each other

k101.name: Night dances of girls
k101.description: Every morning girl' or (rare) boy’s clothes are in disorder, the boy looks very tied. People spy on her (or on him) and discover that she or he spends nights in the non-human world

m44a.name: Thieves of food: the first people
m44a.description: Person discovers that somebody steals game or fish from his trap or devastates his garden. He or his guards catch the thieves who prove to be the first humans beings or the first men

c6g.name: The diver is a wild boar
c6g.description: A wild boar brings the earth from under the water and/or spills it over the water

h35.name: Fragile teeth
h35.description: Human teeth are made of material subject to easy damage (etiology of tooth ache in most cases)

b41a.name: Animal reveals master’s secrets
b41a.description: The dog or other domestic animal speaks aloud about those details of its masters' life that they would prefer to conceal. He is punished by depriving his ability to speak

l17.name: Face on breast
l17.description: There is a headless anthropomorphic being who has eyes and/or mouth on his or her breast

k76b.name: Son the snake.
k76b.description: An (adoptive) son is a snake. He marries a princess, turns into handsome man.

k95.name: United in death
k95.description: Two persons (usually two lovers) are buried in one grave or not far from each other. Two plants which grow on this place interweave or smoke of two funeral pyres is merged

b87.name: Alcor
b87.description: Alcor (a weak star near the second star of the handle of the Big Dipper) is selected as a particular sky object

i65.name: Milky Way of the dead
i65.description: Milky Way is the path over which souls travel to the beyond or a path of the funeral procession

m62f.name: Every next assistant kills previous one
m62f.description: Person invites in succession others to help him in his work. Every next one is stronger than the one who came before and eats him up, the last two perish when they begin to fight

m15.name: Tied to a tree
m15.description: A girl or young woman is tied to the top of a tree or impaled on the sharpened top of a tree and abandoned by a man. Somebody (usually her brothers) attempt to save her

k61c.name: To name a demon
k61c.description: A demon suggests to fulfill a difficult work if the person tells him his name after the work is done. At the last moment the person gets know the name by chance, the demon disappears and the person rewarded for being such a good worker. Or the demon comes to take a child but agrees to give it back if the parents guess his (the demon's) name

b69.name: Chipmunk's back scratched: hence his stripes
b69.description: (Animal)-person wants to thank or to punish small animal (chipmunk, ground squirrel, etc.) and scratches or paints it producing stripes on its back

k27z3.name: The cat with the candle
k27z3.description: A man trains a cat (monkey, dog) to hold lighted candle (lamp) on its head. When a mouse (a rat) runs through the room, the cat drops the candle and chases the mouse

m192a.name: The dried up straps
m192a.description: Animal person agrees to put on a fresh skin of another animal or to be tied up with raw straps. The skin or straps dry up making the person suffer

m39a.name: Fool takes off boots from animals’ legs
m39a.description: Two brothers live with their mother. One of them makes stupid actions like (all or some of them): lets free animals that got into a snare but kills his mother; thinks that an animals (reindeer, cow, horse, etc.) does not want to step into the water because they are afraid to make their shoes or clothes wet, cuts their hooves off or flays them; thinks that a certain place on a head of a baby is a tumor, sucks baby's brains out; cuts a cloth into pieces and ties them to reeds of to branches of a tree; hearing a murmur of water throws food into the water; tries to build a hut not on a river bank but in the river

g13.name: People ate rotten wood
g13.description: Before acquisition of cultivated plants people ate rotten or soft (Ceiba L., Ochroma Sw.) wood; some people eat rotten wood

f9a.name: Vagina dentata
f9a.description: There are teeth or sharp stones in vagina, vagina is a toothed mouth

k84.name: Sisters married to animals
k84.description: Several sisters marry different animals or demons. Usually their husbands help their brother

k36.name: Герой (героиня) временно превращен(а) в животное (обычно в собаку/койота или в осла и т.д.). Обычно когда ему или ей помогают вернуть прежний облик, в животное превращен антагонист. В части текстов метаморфозу испытывает либо только герой, либо только антагонист

h6a.name: People and plants
h6a.description: Mortal humans are contrasted with (almost) immortal trees that shed their bark, become green again after winter sleep or propagate by sprouts

b68.name: The giant grouse
b68.description: Hazel-grouse was big and dangerous. He is torn to pieces which are shared between other birds and animals. What remains is the present grouse

d1a1.name: Mistress of fire carries away woman’s baby
d1a1.description: Because a woman offended the fire, its mistress carries the woman’s baby away

d10.name: Firesticks are two persons
d10.description: A male and a female persons personify fire-sticks

l112.name: Complete body obtained
l112.description: A boy with defective body (too small, only half of a body, only a head) ultimately obtains normal body

h4.name: The shed skin
h4.description: Those who change their skin become young again. In many cases, people are contrasted to snakes, invertebrates or some trees who shed their skin or bark and rejuvenate

b2f.name: Buried in a head
b2f.description: Initially the earth is absent or liquid. Zoomorphic person buries his relatives in his own body or flies carrying the coffin

f67.name: Old woman pretends to be man
f67.description: An old woman makes herself false penis and testicles, marries or attempts to marry her (step)daughter

m144a.name: Burning thatch on the back of a tiger
m144a.description: A trickster (always hare or rabbit) asks a big and dangerous animal (tiger or elephant) to carry some thatch and puts it on fire. After this the same trickster or other animal gives the victim advice to run not to river but up the slope

m65.name: Trickster jammed, meat stolen
m65.description: Trickster cooks meat got by deception but is unexpectedly jammed between trees or stuck to a stone. An animal (usually fox, wolf or coyote) steals all the meat

g28.name: The fish tree
g28.description: Tree contains fish in its trunk

l34.name: Burning hair
l34.description: Hero kills or injures his enemy putting fire on his or her straw costume, mask, headgear, hair or object on his or her back

b2d.name: Marriage of the sky and the earth
b2d.description: The male Sky (the Sun, the Thunder, the creator of the sky) marries the female Earth (or its female creator) or the female Sky marries the male Earth

f44.name: Women and men separate
f44.description: The women and the men of the primeval community quarrel and abandon each other

h8.name: The failed test
h8.description: People lose immortality because they do not dare to touch or drink something loathsome, poisonous, hot or otherwise dangerous

h43.name: One creates the body, another the soul
h43.description: One supernatural creates the body of the first people, another revives them

l108e.name: Children of fox
l108e.description: Fox has a child or children (usually adopts a lamb, foal, etc.), cares for it. Wolf finds and eats it, the fox revenges on him

m149a.name: Treaty with the tiger
m149a.description: A man, light-mindedly or against his own wish, makes an agreement with a dangerous predator. He does not want (cannot) keep it or breaks it and the predator is going to kill him. Somebody intervenes and saves the man.

k35b.name: The most delicious dish
k35b.description: Hero gives his rivals the food provided by him by order of the king but the king finds this food poisonous, useless or tasteless while the food presented by the hero is excellent even if it looks not so good

b73b.name: The cuckoo: in search of lost sibling
b73b.description: Girl searches for her lost brother, calls him or brother calls his sister, or they call each other, or two lost brothers call each other. One or both siblings turn into birds with specific cry

l22a.name: People become blind
l22a.description: After breaking some taboo, coming across a strange object or person, people fall asleep and awake blind

j37.name: Antagonist carried away by bird
j37.description: A man turns into powerful bird or creates it. The bird carries away his enemy

f54a.name: Imperceptible scar (husband proves to be son)
f54a.description: After a rather long marriage, wife discovers some minor traits in her husband guise that help her understand that he is not a proper marriage partner but her close kin (brother or son) or a transformed animal

b79a.name: The bird lain an egg
b79a.description: In the beginning of time a bird flies, lays an egg or eggs, different objects and creatures emerge from them or a bird drops some solid substance on the waters and the dry land or an island appear

c5b.name: Animal-scouts
c5b.description: During the creation of the world or after the world cataclysm animals run around making the earth big, reporting about its condition or they are sent to report the size of the growing earth

k100.name: A faithful servant
k100.description: A man gets to know about dangers that threaten his master or his friend of a higher status. He helps his master (friend) to escape the dangers though his own behavior seems strange or hostile. Facing an alternative to be executed or to turn into stone because of revealing the secret, the helper opts for the second. In many cases the master’s child has to be sacrificed to turn the statue back into the man

h53.name: Wolf is the master of the dead
h53.description: Wolf takes part in creation and/or is a brother of the creator who wins demons of the lower world. Wolf is the first person who died and/or becomes the master of the dead

m36.name: Dismantles himself to crawl through an opening
m36.description: Person is imprisoned inside a tree, stone, a ball of ice, etc. He or somebody else makes the opening but it is too narrow. The person puts himself to pieces (or turns into fog), inserts them into the opening, outside puts the pieces together again

l6.name: Demon clings to person
l6.description: A demonic being demands that a person would carry it permanently, clings to his shoulder or back

k8e.name: Gets inside via anus
k8e.description: Person or animal gets into another being through its anus

j24.name: Grounded to powder
j24.description: Hero is grounded to powder but resuscitates

b45b.name: The bull of cold
b45b.description: Bull or cow are related to winter and cold, responsible for existence of the cold season

f97.name: The prohibited fruit: origin of sex
f97.description: After eating certain fruit, berry, tuber, etc. people become sexually aware

l114.name: The youngest one saves siblings from demon
l114.description: A group of young people comes to a demon. The youngest brother of sister or a sick and invalid person who often accompanies the others against their wish saves them all

m22.name: Helpful stock
m22.description: A long-necked bird living near water (stork, heron, bittern, swan) saves person from dangerous pursuer

j41a.name: Son transforms mother into a bird
j41a.description: When hero returns, he finds his mother being tormented during his absence and transforms her (and usually himself) into a certain bird

h9.name: Strong and weak
h9.description: People are mortal because they have been likened to something subject to decay and easy destruction (e.g. to the soft wood and not to the stone)

m152a.name: Tied together
m152a.description: Two predator animals (an animal and an ogre) tie together with one rope and because of this are injured or dead during a confrontation with a weak person or animal

f9g.name: Brunhilde
f9g.description: A strong woman overcomes and kills suitors. Hero's helper whips and tames her. Hero marries her

m53c.name: Red eyes
m53c.description: Trickster suggests water fowl to dance around him with their eyes shut, kills them one by one. He warns that eyes of a bird who would open them become red. In some versions, the bird who opened its eyes got them really red

k25a1.name: Magic wife finds her clothes
k25a1.description: Magic wife abandons her mortal husband when she finds her clothes (often, her feathers if she is a bird-woman), makes herself the new clothes, receives them from her kin or her husband gives her her clothing believing that she will not abandon him. (Versions with magic wife abandoning her husband because she feels herself offended is not alternative to the “found clothes but in most of the texts these motifs are not combined)

k92a.name: The princess responsible for her own fortune
k92a.description: A girl driven away from home or married to a poor man become prosperous

m80.name: Quail scares trickster
m80.description: Person insults a partridge-like bird, kills or injures her chickens. The partridge scares him, he falls, usually into a river or lake

k104.name: A red swan
k104.description: The youngest of several brothers remains at home, wounds a red swan or duck, goes away following the bird's trace

l23.name: Proteus
l23.description: Person gets hold of another. Trying to free himself, the latter turns into different materials, elements, animals or orders different dangerous creature to attack his opponent

b42o1.name: Ursa major is a fisher
b42o1.description: Ursa major is identified with a fisher (mustela pennati)

m131.name: Biting tree-root
m131.description: A stronger (animal)-person gets to seize a leg or tail of a weaker one. To get free the weaker one pretends that his pursuer got hold of a tree root, and the pursuer lets his enemy free

m56b.name: To bring tears and skins
m56b.description: A weak person's demand will be granted if he brings a skin (paw, tears, etc.) of animals stronger than he. He fulfills the task using tricks (but usually does not receive the promised reward)

e5a.name: Mankind ascends from the underworld
e5a.description: First people (or only first men or first women) are not created but come to earth from the underworld or from a small enclosure under the earth or on its surface (tree trunk, rock, gourd, etc.). Many people of both sexes and of different age or people and different species of animals come out together

h32b.name: Superfertility lost: a maltreated child
h32b.description: A small girl or boy who is a child of a deity comes to live with humans. Thanks to that, food or other resources become easily available. The child is maltreated, returns to its own world, human life becomes difficult and scanty

b52a.name: Vulture creates the landscape
b52a.description: Flying above the earth and flapping its wings, a bird (usually a vulture) makes it dry after the flood or otherwise creates present landscape

f80a.name: Genitals apart from the body
f80a.description: Genitals exist by themselves as separate beings, they can be stuck to the human body, remove, etc.

i100a.name: The Pleiades are mother with children
i100a.description: The Pleiades are a woman with her children

l1c.name: Fugitives turn into stars
l1c.description: A young woman turns into monstrous bear. She kills most of the people besides her younger sister (Ojibwa: younger sister of her former husband). Their brothers return from a hunt, kill the bear or she dies pursuing them

k56a4.name: Dog the messenger
k56a4.description: When the kind girl returns home, a dog barks saying that everything is well with her and when the unkind girl returns (or her dead body is brought home), the dog barks that everything is bad

j48.name: Parrot cuts the sky rope
j48.description: Person ascends to the sky or descends from the sky to earth by a rope. A parrot cuts the rope, the person falls to earth

m110.name: The forgotten liver
m110.description: An animal is tricked to be carried across the water by those who are going to eat or to use as a medicine a part of its body. The animal tells that forgot to take just that part which is needed, is carried back to take it, escapes

m38.name: Stupid imitation (The bungling host)
m38.description: Person sees others act using magic or according to their animal nature. Back at home, he imitates their actions and gets in trouble. Actions are not heroic deeds, competitions or tests and mostly refer to providing and cooking food

f75.name: A siren and a tapir
f75.description: A hunter watches tapir who calls a water woman from the river or lake and copulates with her. Hunter does the same, becomes the woman's lover

i119.name: The dead shake the earth
i119.description: The earthquakes are produced by the dead who are in the underworld or during the earthquakes the inhabitants of the lower world try to come out

m165.name: Fur coat for the wolf
m165.description: One animal person promises to sew a fur coat (or boots) for another and asks to bring him ever more sheep. He eats the meat and sews nothing

m75a.name: Revenge for falling from the sky
m75a.description: Vulture suggests person to carry him in the sky but drops to earth. The person attracts vulture to revenge on him. Or the vulture drops the person (or abandons him on a high rock) to revenge on him for his attempt to catch him

c2b.name: The burned Moon
c2b.description: The Sun and Moon get into conflagration. The Sun survives, the Moon is burned

m114c.name: To protect from rain by his own body
m114c.description: Person cannot understand why the clothes (firewood, etc.) of another are dry after the rain – he protected them with his own body

h38.name: Supernatural person comes after his property
h38.description: Supernatural person changes his guise and comes to the hero's children (more rare, to him). They hand him what he asks for and he disappears with his former property is

h36hh.name: Death and the frog
h36hh.description: Frog or toad is responsible for introduction of permanent death

l3a.name: Asks to be helped
l3a.description: A woman remains alone and calls for somebody who could help her with her housework. A demon comes, kills the woman or her child

k1f.name: Conflict because of a woman
k1f.description: A man maroons another because of jealousy or because he plans to take hold of his wife

m169.name: Medicine for the sick lion
m169.description: In the presence of powerful person one of his subjects is plotting against the other. The other answers that the problem can be resolved if the first one would be maimed (usually a part of his body used as a medicine). The schemer is killed or injured

g12a.name: Plants from drops of blood
g12a.description: Cultivated plants emerge from drops of blood or spill from cuts on the body of a person

j15.name: Woman gets to dangerous creatures
j15.description: Walking in search of her husband, boyfriend, kinsmen, shelter woman or girl gets to the house of dangerous creatures where she is injured or killed

e23.name: Fleas make person move
e23.description: A handful of fleas or lice is thrown into people or into particular person. It was the only way to make him, her or them move and live

m5.name: Provoked insult
m5.description: Being in a situation when his life depends on a good will of a demon or animal, person either resists or does not resist the temptation to insult or to beat, bite, etc. the latter

h36.name: The muddled message
h36.description: Person is sent by god to bring instructions or certain objects but distorts, forgets or replaces them. This has fatal consequences for humans or for a certain species of animals

k136.name: A lad and his cattle
k136.description: A lad becomes a master and a leader of great amount of cattle (cows or buffaloes). A princess finds his hair fallen into a river, the lad and his cattle are called to the king

b64c.name: Small bones: fish fall from the sky
b64c.description: Fish in company of other earth dwellers ascend to fight with the sky dwellers. They fall to earth and break their bones. Since then there are many small bones in the fish

i99.name: The Pleiades are boys or men
i99.description: The Pleiades are a group of boys or men, or a group of different people but predominantly males

e1a.name: First people of unstable materials
e1a.description: First human beings are made of unstable materials (mud, wax, fire, honey, etc.) and unviable

c12a.name: The dog and the world cataclysm
c12a.description: A dog warns people about approaching flood or world conflagration, instructs them what should be done

a43a.name: Person with a shoe on one foot
a43a.description: While being transformed into a bird or ascending to the sky a person was in a hurry and put a footwear only on one foot, or somebody attempted to seize him grasping his foot. Now the corresponding bird or a sky-person is believed to have different feet

e32.name: People born from trees
e32.description: First people are born by trees or come out of a tree, flower, reed

g23a.name: Alive being turns into plants
g23a.description: Person or creature is transformed. Separate parts of its (his, her) body give origin to different plants, mostly edible or cultivated

m29u.name: Trickster is the Moon
m29u.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is the Moon

k65d.name: Wrong marriage ritual and the birth of spirits
k65d.description: The primeval couple is married. First wife has miscarriages or gives birth to spirits, worms or other unpleasant animals. Later, usually after the proper marriage ceremony is organized, she becomes to give birth to real human beings or gods

l25.name: Demonic girl sucks brains
l25.description: People adopt a demonic child, girl or woman but discover that this being kills people (in particular babies left in its charge) sucking out their brains or taking out their eyes

i103.name: The dog star
i103.description: Sirius is associated with a dog or a wolf

a34.name: The fox and the Moon
a34.description: Jackal, coyote, or fox are connected with the Moon (usually with the origin of spots on the lunar disc)

m37.name: Blow of axe
m37.description: Person or person's head is split with the blow of an axe. Person remains (or must remain if the procedure is realized in correct way) uninjured

l76.name: Ogress devours testicles
l76.description: An ogress attacks her male victim devouring or pulling off his testicles

e24.name: Origin of elbows and knees
e24.description: Human arms and legs become pliant (get joints) when a primeval ancestor(s) fall from height and break his arms and legs

m55.name: Sprinkling hot coals
m55.description: A man or a weaker animal leads the stronger one to a place that is allegedly dangerous (hot coals, ashes, sticks, etc. can fall there at night). When his companion is asleep, man throws sticks, sprinkles hot ashes or coals on him pretending that they fall on them both

f7.name: The water-maiden
f7.description: Man takes or attempts to take a wife who is connected with the underwater world (fish, crab, snake, water animal and the like)

g27.name: Plants from urine
g27.description: Person urinates producing the first cultivated plants

m121.name: Louse as a spy
m121.description: Louse or other tiny creature (flee, tuck) is sent to spy on a person

b11a.name: Mammoth creates the landscape
b11a.description: Mammoth described as an underground creature moves across the earth while it is still wet creating the present landscape

f43a.name: The women kill the men
f43a.description: The women of the ancestral community kill, try to kill or transform the men

b41.name: The talking dog
b41.description: Dogs could speak. To prevent them to spread information, the dog is deprived of this ability or the dog rejects it itself

e14a.name: Masks represent the killed demons
e14a.description: People prepare ritual costumes and masks coping the features from the real demons whom they have killed

l82.name: The burned off foot
l82.description: Intentionally or not, a man burns his foot or his whole body in a fire, then turns into demon

m57b.name: Sweat of the Sun and tears of the Moon
m57b.description: Beads or metals are discharged by bodies of deities

i8i.name: Original earth unstable
i8i.description: Originally the earth was unstable and swung, then it was fixed up

l97.name: Rooted to ground
l97.description: A human being cannot move because the lower part of his body is rooted into the ground, stuck to it, or is absent at all

b44f.name: Fox stands for day
b44f.description: In a dispute about should it be dark or light, Fox stands for light

b28d.name: Man transformed into deer, his knives into antlers
b28d.description: Unrecognized Transformer meets a man who tells him that he prepares knives (a spear) to kill Transformer. The latter transforms him into deer, his knives or spear into deer antlers

i8c.name: The suspended earth
i8c.description: The earth does not fall down or swing because it is suspended to ropes

b93.name: Sky bridge in the mid of summer
b93.description: Once a year in the middle of summer sky dwellers or messegers of the deity who are at the opposite sides of the Milky Way come together. Usually birds make a chain of their bodies to serve as a bridge across the celestial river and feathers on the birds' heads become worn down

m42.name: Eyes: lost and found
m42.description: Person loses his eyes because of his playfulness or negligence. He makes new eyes of some substance or/and takes eyes of another person

a32a.name: The Moon rabbit
a32a.description: Rabbit or hare are seen in the moon

m177.name: But he had no heart at all
m177.description: A weak predator eats part of a body of a killed animal and explain to the strong one that this animal did not have such a part at all

l110.name: The devourer
l110.description: A demonic being swallows a multitude of people and animals. When it is killed and cut open, the swallowed ones come out alive or are revived

a29a.name: Torn in half by two wives
a29a.description: The sky wife and the wife from the earth each pull the man to her side tearing him in half

k103.name: Helpful cow
k103.description: Cow (ox, bull) helps an orphan child or a young woman who got into trouble

i76b.name: Mouse turns into bat
i76b.description: After certain time a mouse turns into a bat

f9f.name: Asmodeus
f9f.description: Demon (snake) regularly kills woman’s husbands during the first night, the woman herself being ignorant about the reason of their death

h13.name: Dead person returns and revives
h13.description: Person comes to the land of the dead and brings back somebody who has recently died. This person becomes alive and lives normal life

k22.name: Dwarfs and cranes
k22.description: Different from (common) people inhabitants of a distant land fight with non-human enemies who periodically attack them

i129.name: Constellation of Heron
i129.description: When constellation of Heron appears on the sky, the rain season begins

m81c.name: Blinds met in the sky
m81c.description: Getting to the sky or (rare) to the lower world a man comes across one or two blind persons, then returns to the earth. Usually he cures their eyes

k105.name: Wonderful son and rat-children
k105.description: A despised wife gives birth to wonderful human children, other wives give birth to animals

l31.name: People stick to monster
l31.description: People against their will must follow an object, a creature, or a person (usually stick to it) who/which leads or carries them far away, usually into the water or to the sky

b42l.name: Animal is the dipper, hunters are the handle
b42l.description: Stars of the handle of the Big Dipper are identified with the hunters, the dipper itself with the game (bear or elk)

f84.name: Prolonged celibacy imitated
f84.description: Person has sex with the wife of his host or brother. Trying to conceal his deed, he puts ashes or juice of a fruit on his glans that has to prove his long celibacy

i7a.name: The lightning- serpent
i7a.description: The lightning is associated with a snake

k10c.name: Wrapped in guts
k10c.description: Hero (or twins) hangs on his body a bag with animal bowels full of blood. Breaking them with its claws, the bird thinks that its victim is killed and brings the man to its nest. He kills the adult bird, kills or transforms its nestlings

m109.name: The tail-fisher
m109.description: Animal person advices another animal to put its tail into ice-hole to fish, to get treasure, etc. The tail sticks to ice, to snags, etc.

b7a.name: The spit out water
b7a.description: Somebody is the only possessor of water or certain beverage. Another person drinks it, escapes and spits out making it available for the people

k26a.name: Sky opening covered with a stone
k26a.description: Opening in the firmament is covered with a flat stone. When person puts the stone aside, he or she gets to see the earth

h12b.name: Ghosts feed on excrements
h12b.description: Inhabitants of the land of the dead eat excrements

e35.name: Webbed fingers
e35.description: First people or people made by Creator's rival were imperfect, not completely anthropomorphic (often: had webbed fingers)

l109.name: The cannibal gourd
l109.description: A gourd proves to be a cannibal or grows from remains of a monster

c16.name: Processed objects turn into animals
c16.description: Against person's will, butchered, dried or cooked meat, tanned hides, etc. turn back into animals or fish and escape.

j56.name: Father tests his sons
j56.description: Twin heroes (or one boy) come to their divine father. He puts them under trials to get know if they are really his children and possess supernatural power

i100c.name: The Pleiades and a cuckoo
i100c.description: God transformed man into a cuckoo, his wife and children into the Pleiades

m188.name: The painted jackal
m188.description: Animal person is highly respected by others after he changes his looks by chance; is smeared with a paint or gets a necklace-like object around his neck which he is unable to pull off

b49a.name: How many cubs in a year
b49a.description: Mighty animals lost opportunity to have many children and now give birth only once in several years

e9.name: The mysterious housekeeper
e9.description: A man (rare, a woman) lives alone. In his or her absence, somebody puts his or her house in order, prepares his or her meals or (rare) eats food up, makes a disorder. He or she discovers that a woman (a young man) lives unrecognized (in animal form, hiding in an object) in or near the house or comes during his or her absence

m74ab.name: Fox in a boat
m74ab.description: Travelling in a boat or on a sledge, animal person (always the fox) steals food supplies or ruins objects and accordingly to his deeds, names different places. These names seem strange to the person’s companions (“River of broken arrows” and the like)

m114d.name: Chickens from the boiled eggs
m114d.description: Person claims that chickens can be brooded from the boiled eggs or wants his opponent to grow a hen during one day. The opponent suggests for the first person equally impossible task

m52.name: Butchered carcass
m52.description: A small animal (not a predator) or a weak person kills a big game. He asks another (animal-)person to skin or butcher the carcass. The latter is willing but takes or tries to take all the meat for himself

b38c.name: Tail base of the loon
b38c.description: Person kicks loon or other water bird. Since then this bird has flat tail base and it walks on dry land with difficulty

m30a.name: Person defecates on a trickster
m30a.description: Trickster who flies over a village falls to the ground. They bind him and defecate on him

j30.name: Parents’ remains
j30.description: Before the hero destroys the antagonists or escapes from them, he finds or receives the remains or possessions that belonged to the antagonists' victim

a36.name: The immortal Moon
a36.description: Moon, unlike people, revives or rejuvenates every month; or those who live in the Moon are immortal; or the Moon makes decision if people should die forever or regularly revive

l5c.name: Rolling head pursues people
l5c.description: A monstrous head pursues luminaries, people or sticks to person's body

j14.name: A flute-player
j14.description: A girl or two sisters walk in search of the man whose beautiful voice or whose flute-play they listen

m11b.name: Meat extracted from body
m11b.description: A woman serves a man a good meat cut from her own body and does not do it anymore when the man got to know about the source of the meat

m91a.name: Simulating killing (a bag with blood)
m91a.description: Person conceals under clothes a bladder with blood or red juice and piercing it, simulates killing or suicide or demonstrates that he can cut his bowels and remain alive

c8a.name: Grinding stones match
c8a.description: Being alone and having no other marriage partners, brother and sister agree to marry each other if a highly improbable event or a series of events will take place. Among the events that take place (alternatively or one after the other) are 1) the siblings let two grinding stones roll from two mountains, the brother's stone falls on the sister's one; 2) brother and sister throw two swords from two mountains, both swords get into one sheath; 3) they throw some objects up, the objects get together; 4) they kindle two fires, columns of smoke get together; 5) they put to grow two stems of bamboo, tops of the stems get together

f31.name: The broken egg
f31.description: Girl or woman is imperceptibly impregnated by snake when the content of a broken egg of a snake flows into her vagina or when she touches a dead snake

m29g.name: Trickster-hare or rabbit
m29g.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is hare or rabbit

k56b.name: The worthy man is rewarded, the unworthy punished
k56b.description: First one, then another man meets a powerful person or persons. The first man is worthy and rewarded with treasure, prestige or the like. The second man (or two men) follows him, behaves in a wrong way and is punished

m120a.name: Cannibal mourner
m120a.description: Somebody dies, animal person suggests to be a mourner, eats the corpse

b48.name: Predators become herbivorous
b48.description: Weak or herbivorous animals were dangerous predators but have been transformed

f66.name: The false house
f66.description: Person’s father, grandson, brother, or sister pretends to be a stranger to commit incest (accordingly with the daughter, grandmother, sister, or brother), or a husband shams to be his wife’s brother because he wants to be taken by her as her blood relative. To realize his or her stratagem, the hero imperceptibly runs to another house where the object of his or her interest later comes and takes him or her for a stranger

f34.name: Land animal paramour
f34.description: Certain woman or a group of women takes for a paramour a big land animal. Husbands, brothers or (adoptive) children kill or maim paramour and (sometimes) the woman

k29d.name: The drunk elephants
k29d.description: When water in a spring is replaced with alcohol, a big animal becomes drunk and is caught

m65a.name: Squeaking tree
m65a.description: Trees squeak in the wind. Trickster hears a noise, climbs up the tree and is caught between limbs

i8g.name: Atlas
i8g.description: One giant supports the earth or the sky

f72.name: Imitated violence
f72.description: A woman asks a man to tie her before copulation in such a way that a watcher would think she is raped

k41.name: Thunder against a serpent
k41.description: Thunder or giant bird fights against a reptile, big water animal or other big and strong creature who lives in water or under the earth

h22.name: Sense of smell
h22.description: Big game animals obtain sense of smell and/or become to escape from hunters after a person makes them olfactory organs or lets them feel strong odor

k47a.name: A woman and a dog
k47a.description: A woman takes a dog paramour, marries him, gives birth to his children. The puppies turn into human children and usually become ancestors of some groups of people

m77.name: A soiled bed
m77.description: While person is asleep, another smears with excrements or something that reminds excrements his or her bed or clothes. The ashamed person runs away or agrees to make what the trickster wants in exchange of his silence

l93a.name: Helpful fox
l93a.description: Cunning fox, jackal or coyote saves particular person or many people, helps them

f46.name: One for all
f46.description: The only existing or available woman is used sexually by many men (animal people)

b30b.name: Murdered person turns into game animals
b30b.description: Different game animals emerge from remains of a murdered person

f59.name: Man to woman: modified body
f59.description: To make believe that he is a female, a trickster transforms particular objects or creatures into female body parts or into a baby child

i78.name: The square earth
i78.description: The earth is square, the sky is usually round

g8d.name: Falling or growing up of a tree is dangerous to the world
g8d.description: To save the world (gods, king, etc.) certain persons or creatures try to cut or gnaw a tree (post, mountain) or do not permit the others to do. The notch disappears and the tree (post, etc.) becomes intact

h1bb.name: The not revived dog
h1bb.description: Person refuses to revive a dog which is dear to another person, and this conflict is related to the missed opportunity to revive people

m127.name: Lost tail of fox
m127.description: Trickster animal has a narrow escape and loses his tail. To make himself unrecognizable among other animals of his species, he tricks them to lose their tails too

i107.name: Stars are nails
i107.description: Stars are nails in the firmament or pegs, or stars are nailed to the sky

k27i.name: Task: to dry a body of water
k27i.description: A task: to dry a body of water

j4.name: Death of the father
j4.description: Heroes avenge their (grand)father's or uncles' death, not the death of their mother or both parents

m93.name: Body part as a guard
m93.description: Before falling asleep, person tells his eyes (which he extracts and puts aside) or his anus to awake him in case of danger. Eyes or anus do not make an alarm or person himself does not react to it. As a result he suffers a damage

l61.name: Endocannibal
l61.description: Person devours his or her own flesh or disembowels himself or herself

i29.name: Armadillo’s hole leads to the underworld
i29.description: Person crawls after an armadillo into its hole and gets into the underworld or digs a hole and gets into the world of the armadillos

e20.name: Fish poison person
e20.description: Entering water, certain person makes fish die. From parts of his body or from his grave grows plant used to prepare fish poison (timbo)

b48a.name: Other creatures’ flesh
b48a.description: Particular pieces of flesh or inner organs in the bodies of animals, birds, or fish originally belonged to other creatures

k27u1.name: One day from conception to birth
k27u1.description: A demand is brought up that a baby would be born the next day after conception or would talk immediately after the birth

h24b.name: Souls disappear from the opened container
h24b.description: Person receives a container with the soul of a dead person and has to open it not before he gets to particular place or after particular time interval. He opens it too early, the soul fly away

i122.name: The Pleiades are insects
i122.description: The Pleiades are a nest, a congestion of insects

e6a.name: Way across waters
e6a.description: To reach their present country, people had to pass (frozen) water body. Part of the migrants remain on the opposite side or is drowned

f18c.name: Girls at the opposite bank
f18c.description: Seeing a girl on the opposite bank of a river, person uses tricks to have sex with her: sends his long penis, a stream of his seed or some object across the river into her vagina; transforms his penis into a bridge or a dam; dives and copulates with a girl from under the water

h30.name: A wrong choice
h30.description: Seeing two women who have come together or in succession, man has to choose one of them. Usually he takes the one who is less pretty and smart or more dangerous inflicting troubles on himself and humanity

i52.name: Fish the earth-holder
i52.description: World is supported by fish or fish-like monster or the earth itself is such a monster

f81.name: Bride in a river
f81.description: A man mistakes his own reflection in river for a beautiful woman and makes attempts to marry her

f53.name: Ugly husband
f53.description: An ugly man marries a girl but conceals his face. Marriage is ruined after his face is seen

d4m.name: Fire owners dance
d4m.description: Person comes to the owners of fire or light. They feast and dance. He joins them and in a proper moment carries away the valuables

d13e.name: Hunters laugh at killed animals
d13e.description: Hunters perish because they were laughing at the killed (and revived) animal

k75.name: Bridegroom of the youngest daughter (The loathsome bridegroom)
k75.description: A girl (usually the youngest of several sisters) does not reject but marries a poor, sick, dirty, old, too young, non-human, etc. man who later demonstrates his supernatural qualities

l44.name: Show me your head!
l44.description: A man hides in a shelter. An ogre wants him to demonstrate certain parts of his body. The man demonstrates or parts of the body of an animal or some objects. The ogre believes that his adversary is a powerful creature

h27.name: Mosquitoes let lose
h27.description: Stinging insects (rare diseases) had been inside a container or some enclosure. They escaped to the world when the container or enclosure was foolishly opened

h15.name: Whisper and yawning
h15.description: If called in a loud voice, ghosts do not hear an alive person but hear whisper, yawning, etc.

e30a.name: Make-believe spouse replaced with alive person
e30a.description: Person does not have a spouse, uses wooden fakes for his wife or her husband till alive person comes to replace it

f56a.name: Shavings into the fire
f56a.description: To create opportunity to see female genitals, a man throws something combustible into the fire which makes the woman fall on her back and expose her vagina

k80.name: Person not subject to annihilation
k80.description: Person turns into different objects which another person tries to destroy. Every time a particle of an object remains and undergoes a new metamorphosis. In most case an imposter replaces the true wife or bride and attempts to destroy her but her vital essence passes to different plants and objects. Ultimately the woman acquires her human image again

m195.name: Two horse: which is older?
m195.description: Person should guess which of two horses is older. He does it considering peculiarities of the habits of horses

e5b.name: First couple from the underworld
e5b.description: First man or first human couple come out from the underworld or from a small enclosure on its surface (tussock, reed, tree, rock, gourd)

l15f.name: Heroine’s life in her necklace
l15f.description: A young woman or (rare) a youth falls dead when her necklace (rare: an organ) is stolen from her and revives again as soon as she gets it back or when the antagonist takes it off

k1c.name: One who comes to look at adversary’s bones dies himself
k1c.description: A man is marooned on an islet, a rock but survives thanks to helpful birds and animals. The next time the hero and the antagonist exchange roles. Usually the antagonist comes to the islet to see the bones of the abandoned man but the man takes the canoe of the antagonist and paddles away. The antagonist dies

m127b.name: A jug as trap
m127b.description: Animal person attaches a vessel or its part to his body, puts it into the water, the vessel is heavy and drags him into the water

f70e1.name: Daughter instead of son
f70e1.description: An old man needs a son to accomplish a man’s work or service. (Only the youngest) daughter sets to do it (successfully passing her father’s test and) guised as a man

b99.name: Turned into nest of insects
b99.description: Person abandoned in a tree turns into a nest of insects

e17.name: Origin of design
e17.description: Humans acquire (the idea of) ornamentation of the vessels, baskets, body, etc. after somebody gets to see the pattern on the skin of zoomorphic and/or supernatural creature. Design on the objects copies (is an imprint of) a pattern on such a skin

k119a.name: Ungrateful master
k119a.description: An animal makes a poor man rich, gets for him a bride. Then the man becomes prosperous, he rejects his helper

m100.name: Sleep at the edge of a cliff
m100.description: One animal-person suggests another to lie asleep at the edge of a bluff or cliff. At night he tells him to move a little, the companion falls down and dies

l10a.name: Demon comes to hunter’s camp-fire
l10a.description: A hunter spends night in a desolate place. A demon comes to his fire. When the demon falls asleep or goes away for a while, the hunter puts his clothes over a log and hides nearby. When the demon attacks the log taking it for the man, the hunter wounds or kills the demon

k67b.name: Bargain not to become angry
k67b.description: Person of a low social position (who has no supernatural abilities) agrees to a contest with a person of high social position (or with an ogre, etc.)that whoever becomes angry first must suffer a severe punishment. The weaker person abuses the stronger one until the latter erupts in anger.

l42.name: Hero carried to ogre’s home
l42.description: An ogre or ogress brings hero home where he or she plans to cook and eat him. The hero escapes

m157a.name: You are hens and I am  the cock
m157a.description: To put a person into an awkward position, others demonstrate chicken eggs that they prepared beforehand. Having no egg with him, the person says that he is the only cock while all the others are hens

k90a.name: Stag antlers stuck in serpent’s throat
k90a.description: Antlers of a stag or tusks of an elephant who a serpent tries to swallow are stuck in its throat

h23.name: Fat horns
h23.description: Objects that are now stiff and inedible  (animal horns, tree fungi, heartwood) contained fat or marrow

m79.name: Dancing with reeds
m79.description: Person joins dancers but then understands that these are trees or reeds moved by the wind

m57d.name: Beat, cudgel!
m57d.description: Person first gets magic objects that bring food or treasure and after this he receives a cudgel (a whip, etc.) that beats people, usually those who have stolen the first objects. (In Greek text the stealer of magic objects is punished otherwise)

i77.name: The lame thunder
i77.description: Powerful person connected with thunder and rain is lame (usually after falling down from the sky)

m166.name: Piece among animals
m166.description: To lure his potential victim down from a tree, a predator pretends not to be dangerous (usually announces that it has been decreed that all animals are united in piece). The victim is dubious and usually asks the predator to announce the same news to the dogs. The predator runs away

i32a.name: Tree of human life
i32a.description: When a leave or a fruit of a certain tree drops, one of the people on the earth dies

k126.name: Wolf pays for the eaten up horse
k126.description: A wolf eats up hero's horse but gives him a fare compensation (usually provides a wife)

k77b.name: Bremen town musicians
k77b.description: Domestic animals get to a place where they meet predators. They frighten them making them to escape

i116.name: Milky Way is the border between the seasons
i116.description: The Milky Way is the border-line between seasons of the year or parts of the universe (the wet and the dry seasons, the sky and the earth, etc.)

b75a.name: Sounds of the time of creation: a woman's voice (echo)
b75a.description: A certain woman lived in primeval time but her voice is still heard (usually she turns into echo)

j2.name: The tree-husband
j2.description: A girl marries a man or is impregnated by man who is or was incarnated in a tree

k26.name: A hole in the firmament
k26.description: Finding a hole in the ground or making it, person gets to see below another world. Usually the earth is seen from the sky

j12l.name: A hypocritical murderer
j12l.description: A murderer of a valuable marriage-partner pretends to mourn over him. His trick is exposed, people chase him

m24a.name: Turtle kills a woman
m24a.description: Turtle goes to war, kills people (usually a woman), is caught and killed but continues to live in its animal guise

k44a.name: Frog pretends to be mother
k44a.description: An amphibian (frog, toad, rare newt) steals or finds a boy, lies him that she is his real mother

i26.name: Dangers on the way of souls
i26.description: On its way to the Beyond, a soul has to defend itself or divert attention of guards who wait for it giving presents to them

l40a.name: Woman takes reflection of a youth for her own
l40a.description: An ugly woman gets to see in water a reflection of a youth who is up in a tree. She takes it for her own reflection and thinks that she has become beautiful

h3.name: Sham funerals bring death
h3.description: People become mortal because they imitated real funerals burying an animal

h50.name: Sky god and mistress of the dead
h50.description: A couple of deities or ancestors divorces. Man remains on earth or ascends to the sky, woman becomes the mistress of the dead or of the underworld

m103.name: Children with pretty spots
m103.description: Person asks another how her or his children got their pretty colors. Another answers that she or he put them into the fire. roasted, etc. The first person believes, kills his or her children

j18a.name: Mother is eaten up, children escape
j18a.description: An ogress devours a woman, gets into her house. Her daughters (daughter and son, one daughter) run away, climb a tree or a rope that hangs from the sky. Ogress pursues them and perishes

k73.name: Children of the youngest wife
k73.description: A young woman promises to bear a wonderful child. In her husband's absence other people (co-wives, mother-in-law, etc.) try to kill the mother and/or the child, usually slandering her

b52b.name: Some earth is concealed
b52b.description: Person spits out earth that he swallowed or concealed otherwise. This way the broken landscape is created

m60a2.name: False servant licks soles
m60a2.description: A servant has to lick soles or a wound of his master or mistress. The hero comes disguised as the servant and instead of licking the soles rubs them (rubs the wound) with a cut off animal tongue

m172.name: The hare makes the lion his horse
m172.description: To demonstrate that a strong animal is his slave or his riding animal, a weak animal tricks the strong one to carry him. People believe that the strong one is really a slave of the weak one

i49.name: The running earthquake
i49.description: Earthquake is a person. Whenever he or she runs or walks, the earth trembles

l50.name: Cliff ogre
l50.description: An ogre or robber waits for passers-by near a narrow path, distracts their attention and kicks them, usually pushing down into a precipice, lake, etc.

i7.name: The cloud serpent
i7.description: A flying reptile produces rain, thunderstorm

f88.name: Odor of women
f88.description: Initially women's genitals were fragrant or had no smell. Because of a bad chance they acquire unpleasant odor or do not acquire fragrant odor

l42c.name: Now in, now outdoors
l42c.description: Person hides from the powerful one now in his house, now outdoors, the powerful cannot catch him

m29j.name: Trickster is a water bird
m29j.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a water bird

b56.name: Fire tongue of crocodile
b56.description: After the crocodile or caiman swallows or loses fire (that he possessed before), he remains without his tongue; or the crocodile's tongue is cut off to make something related to celestial fire (thunderbolt, sun beams, etc.

l33.name: Rolling stone
l33.description: Stone chases people to crash them

b3b.name: Earth grows big
b3b.description: Original earth was small and later increased in size or the fertile soil grew from a small amount of original substance

k77bb.name: Weapons of a goat
k77bb.description: A predator animal asks a goat (a ram, etc.) about a purpose of certain parts of his body. The goat describes every part as a weapon able to injure his opponent or the goat really possesses weapons

k38c.name: Bird carries hero to his destination
k38c.description: Hero helps a powerful bird (usually does good to her nestlings), grateful bird carries him to the place where he is eager to get or tells to do it one of her nestlings

k22aa.name: Humans in the south, birds in the north
k22aa.description: A man gets to the country inhabited by migratory birds. They have there human guise but turn into birds going back to the north

b77a.name: Giant pushed the sky up
b77a.description: One or several (animal)-persons push sky up to its present height

f21.name: Woman turns into a tree, penis captured
f21.description: Man copulates with a woman who turns into tree or rock, his penis is captured in it

k68.name: Blood-clot defends his stepfather
k68.description: A weak man abused by a strong one (often his son-in-law) brings home a clot of animal’s blood, from which a child is born. The blood-clot boy avenges the old man

k23.name: Battle with birds
k23.description: Birds attack the inhabitants of a distant land or a man who had got to this land

d12.name: Food baked in the sun
d12.description: First people or inhabitants of a distant country cook food in the sun; or fire owner lies that he or she cooks food in the sun

h26.name: Mosquitoes had to be drowned
h26.description: The right way to dispose of container with stinging insects would be to throw it into the river or sea or bury in a far away place, but it was not done

f70d.name: A disgraced informer
f70d.description: A castrate or girl pretends to be a man or a cripple girl conceles her injury. Some person gets to know about it and plans to expose the deception. At the last moment the hero or heroine magically becomes a real man (gets back the lost members) and the informer is disgraced

i50a.name: Torn off legs
i50a.description: A demon tears off or devours one by one legs of a riding animal of the hero

k32.name: The false wife
k32.description: An ugly, old, lazy, etc. woman or a male trickster comes to man under disguise of his wife, bride or (more rare) sister who is driven out, confined to the underworld, killed, etc.

i22b.name: Birds fly to the outer world
i22b.description: Migratory birds fly from our world to the outer world under the edge of the sky which is rising and falling or through a narrow opening. Many birds perish. Eventual details: person who lives at this place feeds on these birds; it can be mistress of birds lives on another side of the pulsating obstacle

m69.name: Head caught in animal skull
m69.description: A small animals or insects dance or feast inside big animal skull or food is there. Trickster inserts his head into the skull and cannot take it out for a long time

j9.name: Unborn children talk from the womb
j9.description: A woman is in search of her husband or other person or object. Her unborn children speak from her stomach and shows her the correct way

l108.name: To wash a black one
l108.description: Person is or becomes black and has to sit in the water till becomes white. An antagonist carries him or her away

b24.name: Transformation of kinsmen into wild pigs
b24.description: Person transforms into wild pigs his kinsmen or children

l106a.name: Stomach cut open
l106a.description: An antagonist makes a demand to the hero which is correct in form but really is unjustified. The hero fulfills the claims or is punished. Now antagonist takes an object or animal possessed by the hero, is unable to give it back and is punished

f28a1.name: Jumping penis
f28a1.description: Alive penis exists as a separate being able to move and attack people

k19e.name: Wolverine under a tree
k19e.description: When a woman or two sisters descend from sky back to earth, they get to the top of a tree. Some animals who walk by cannot help them or do not want to help. Wolverine gets women down because he plans to marry them but they escape from him

l117.name: Unwanted companion
l117.description: When a man goes to marry, an evil spirit joins him, helps him in the village of his bride, etc. but then claims at least half of the bride for himself. (In Gola story a man gets a wife for a spirit and claims a half of her)

m56d.name: To fill container with flies
m56d.description: Person promises to fill container with small flying creatures which are alive. When he expresses his doubts that the creatures are numerous enough to fill the container, they fly in and he closes the lid

m13a.name: Transformed into stone
m13a.description: God agrees or suggests to fulfill a demand of a man. As a result the latter is transformed into a stone

f43.name: First women disappear
f43.description: The women of the ancestral community kill or abandon the men

f86a.name: An eaten up pet
f86a.description: Person take care for a fish, crab or other small creature. Another person spies on him or her, kills the pet and eats it up or try to do it

k91.name: An invisible battle
k91.description: Hero's dogs or horse or (rare) he himself fight with his adversary in the underworld (under the water). Those who are waiting for the outcome of the combat understand who overcomes whom by the color of water or foam that rises to the surface

b62.name: Buzzard husband
b62.description: Man thinks that buzzard or hawk has better life than he. They exchange clothes. The bird lives with the man's wife as her husband, the man usually does not enjoy his bird life

j40a.name: Avenged prisoners
j40a.description: After the hero comes back after a long absence and finds his parents enslaved, he tells them to demonstrate openly a lack of respect to their masters and punishes those who were cruel with them

b42mm.name: The boaster and the hurried one
b42mm.description: In the cosmic hunt tales according to which stars of the handle of the Big Dipper are three hunters, each of the hunters demonstrates particular psychological characteristics (one is a boaster, another is a hurried one, etc.). Usually these hunters are identified with peoples of different ethnic groups or with different species of birds

m73.name: Exchanged excrements
m73.description: Two (animal) persons compare their feces or vomits to know about the diet and habits of each other. The weaker one gets to exchange the feces (vomits)

m182b.name: The wild animals on the sleigh
m182b.description: Wild animals ride on a sleigh, which breaks. To repair it the animals bring unsatisfactory material from the forest. When the sleigh owner goes for good material they eat the horse (or the bull) and build a dummy to replace it

j27a.name: Thrown-away kills his father
j27a.description: One of two babies is thrown away and lives in the water, in the forest, etc., another lives in the house; after both of them become to live in the house, they kills their father

m29p.name: Trickster is a spider
m29p.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a spider

i81.name: Waters rush down into the underworld
i81.description: Waters of all rivers on earth run to the precipice where they rush down into the underworld

a13a.name: Raven steals the Sun
a13a.description: Raven steals (hides) the Sun or tries to do it

i9.name: Colors of the cardinal directions
i9.description: Four cardinal directions and/or some objects associated with them are associated with different colors

g12c.name: Fox brings plants from the sky
g12c.description: Fox or coyote returns from the sky and disperses seeds or shoots unknown on earth before

b21.name: Destruction of the world tree
b21.description: People ascend the tree to hunt, fish, or gather food in the sky. The tree is destroyed, people fall to earth or remain in the upper world

f9e.name: Mice in vagina
f9e.description: There are small mammals with sharp teeth in woman's genitals.

m176.name: A test: to jump across a brook
m176.description: (Animal) persons agree to jump across a brook or streamlet, to cross it walking along a log, a rope and the like. One or all of them fall down

k24.name: Stolen clothes of supernatural woman
k24.description: Women who possess supernatural power and usually come from a non-human world (from sky, from under the water, they are winged beings, bird- or animal-persons) take off their clothes (feather skins and the like) or part of it. After the man hides clothes, their owner has to marry him or help him

k33a1.name: Children born in a well
k33a1.description: Pregnant woman is thrown into a well (pond, hole, etc.) where she gives birth to a son (children). She and her children brought alive

e15a.name: Breast bone as a canoe model
e15a.description: Frame of canoe is made according to breast bone of a bird

e9c.name: Elephant-, buffalo-, elk-wife
e9c.description: Man marries a woman who has a nature of a big non-predatory animal or comes out of its body (elephant, buffalo, doe, elk, etc.)

f47a.name: Men use pieces of woman’s flesh
f47a.description: Every man uses for copulation certain part of an only woman or takes a part of her body after it was cut into pieces

i111.name: The earth is a reptile
i111.description: The earth is the body of a crocodile or a dragon

e30.name: The make-believe spouse of wood
e30.description: Person does not have a spouse, uses wooden fakes for his wife or her husband

k52b.name: Broken adze
k52b.description: A man comes to the non-human beings to get a woman. He secures the help of a slave repairing his adze or axe

a16.name: Dangers along the Sun’s way
a16.description: Every night the Sun and/or the Moon passes by creatures or objects which try to destroy them

j43.name: Bait for antagonists
j43.description: To kill his antagonists, hero lures them with an attractive object which is delicious to eat and is usually on the other side of a body of water or a canyon

b74a.name: The marriage of the owl and the Moon
b74a.description: Owl had to separate with the Moon and since then cries when the Moon shines. Usually the (proposed) marriage of the owl and the Moon broke up

e15b.name: Birds sew canoe covering
e15b.description: While man is asleep, birds turn into girls and sew covering of his canoe

m94a.name: Wolf in a basket
m94a.description: Person tricks another to crawl into a basket and closes it. One in a basket is killed or badly injured (usually rolled down a hill)

b3d.name: Earth from worm’s excrements
b3d.description: A worm obtains the earth (from the underworld), it emerges from the worm's excrements, is extracted from inside of the worm

i8h.name: A man and a woman hold the earth
i8h.description: Two anthropomorphic beings, a male and a female, are in the underworld and support the earth

h22a.name: Animals disperse after being touched by people
h22a.description: Big game animals were concentrated in one place, had no fear of people. They escape and disperse after somebody slightly strikes or stains them

k27yy.name: To get a bird from a tree
k27yy.description: Hero is sent to a dangerous tree or rock to bring feathers, nestling, fruits, bark, etc.

m53.name: Hoodwinked dancers
m53.description: Person invites birds or animals (usually geese and ducks) to dance or stand around him and concentrate their attention on some activity (usually to dance with their eyes shut), kills them, usually one by one. Or (rare) he dances himself with his eyes shut and then kills water fowl who gather around him

b64d.name: Bones in the birds’ leg
b64d.description: Small bones in the legs of birds of particular species or spots on their feathers are arrows shot into them from below

h36c.name: Death and the lizard
h36c.description: Lizard is responsible for introduction of permanent death

m62c.name: Pulling a rope
