c5a.description: Birds or humans who are later changed to birds are send to explore the earth (is it dry, are any survivals, to bring some dry soil, to investigate why smoke rises to the sky, etc.)

m3a.name: Counting water animals
m3a.description: Animal who does not swim well suggests animals who live in water to count their number. For this, they should make a chain and he would run along it. It is but a trick to cross a body of water

m154.name: The animal language and the stubborn wife
m154.description: A man obtains knowledge of animal languages but if he reveals the secret, he must die. Once he hears animals talking and laughs. His wife thinks that he laughs at her or at her mother. The man is ready to open his secret and either does it and dies or hears how animals (usually a cock) blame him for being so foolish. So he keeps his secret.

k131.name: Men fight over magic objects
k131.description: A man on a journey meets tree or two persons who are quarreling over the division of magic objects (a flying carpet, seven mile boots, etc.). The man promises to render a judgment, but he  asks first to try our the objects or suggests the owners to run a race and uses opportunity to escape with the objects

f53a.name: Bat or owl hides his face
f53a.description: A man hides his face from his wife because she does not know that he is a nocturnal being (a bat or an owl)

h20.name: Fish disperse in the world
h20.description: All the fish or (rare) shellfish) was concentrated in one place. Certain person lets it lose or puts it into the rivers or sea

j32a.name: To guard father’s grave
j32a.description: Before passing away a man asks his sons to guard his grave for a certain time or to bring something to his grave. The youngest son goes and obtains valuables

m29n.name: Trickster is a mouse
m29n.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a mouse

i30.name: Master of the dead welcomes women
i30.description: Master or mistress of the realm of the dead copulates with every new human soul of the opposite sex who arrives to his or her realm

f64a.name: Describes future husband
f64a.description: Going away or pretending to die, a person bids his or her relative to marry another person who resembles him (her) or has some special traits; or he describes a man who should be met as a dear guest; person comes himself unrecognized and is taken for one whom he had described

i96.name: Bloody rainbow
i96.description: Rainbow is blood, associated with war and death

l93.name: Axe thrown into the water
l93.description: Person escapes to a tree or a high rock. An ogre tries to cut it down. While the ogre has a rest, an animal throws his axe into the water or carries it away

b44b.name: Council on seasons: toes, claws, hairs, feathers
b44b.description: Toes, claws, feathers, hairs, color stripes, etc. are counted and compared to establish the number of period of time or particular way of alternation of periods

a4b.name: The Sun is afraid of the night
a4b.description: Being afraid of the night, the Sun decided to travel across the sky only at the day time

m86.name: Rock punishes trickster
m86.description: Rock chases or otherwise punishes person who has offended it (usually deceived it or has taken objects that belong to Rock)

m38a.name: Imitating wife’s kinfolk
m38a.description: Person imitates actions of his son- or brothers-in-law or (among Comox and Halcomelem) of his wives

l119.name: Battle in the air
l119.description: Hero and antagonist fight in the air tearing off each other limbs. Usually their allies on earth preserve limbs of their leader and destroy limbs of the adversary

k102a.name: Father was right
k102a.description: A man tells his son to kill his sister, mother, or wife. The young man does not fulfill the order but later regrets about it

m97.name: Blind directed by trees
m97.description: Person becomes blind or loses his way. He walks asking different trees their names, makes decisions accordingly to their answers and ultimately reaches his destination

f24.name: Origin of menses: a bite
f24.description: Women bleed because fish or snake bites them. Usually it is invisible fish inside their body

g23b.name: Alive being turns into nations
g23b.description: Different body parts of a huge being turn into people of different ethnic affiliation or such people receive their names and characteristics according to body parts that they got

b71.name: Aurora borealis
b71.description: Aurora borealis is spirits (of the dead) who run holding burning torches, play or fight with each other

m29d.name: Trickster-mink
m29d.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is mink

l65a.name: The cannibal sister
l65a.description: A girl born to the family or found proves to be a monster, devours people. Her brother escapes, (usually marries and returns home, finds that everybody had been eaten up), runs away, she pursues him but cannot get

l110a.name: The injured ear
l110a.description: A demonic being swallows a person or (in African versions) a multitude of people and animals. Hero kills the monster but cutting open its body, injures a person who was inside. Usually this person is offended and finds opportunity to kill the hero

i68.name: Opening of the sky
i68.description: On a certain day, the sky vault opens and the interior of the sky is seen; usually any wish expressed at this moment will be fulfilled

h2.name: The selfish animal
h2.description: Animals ask God to make people mortal because people would be too numerous and step on the animals, deprive them of their food and habitat, or because the animals want to feast on the human corpses

f94.name: Rival wives in the sky
f94.description: A man gets to the sky where he has a choice to marry one of two women, one of them being connected with life and another with death

f45a.name: Conception from wind
f45a.description: Before women got know how to conceive children from men, they exposed their genitals to the wind, sun and water; the women who live alone without men conceive children this way

i71.name: Stars are plants
i71.description: Stars are plants or roots of the plants which grow in the upper world

b2b.name: The earth eats the dead
b2b.description: The earth devours bodies of the people when they die and are buried

i1.name: The thunderbirds
i1.description: Creatures that produce rain and/or thunderstorms are birds or anthropomorphic beings with wings; or (rare) some or all birds are connected with thunder, lightning or rain though Thunder is not a bird

l1d.name: Woman kills jaguar
l1d.description: A were-jaguar kills most of the people but is killed itself thanks to a woman who remained alive

e8a.name: Women from coconuts
e8a.description: Coconuts picked off a palm or fallen to the ground (rare: leaves picked off a tree) turn into women or into both women and men

k33.name: Drowned woman remains alive
k33.description: A young woman is transformed into an animal, pushed into the water, into the underworld or she herself has to plunge into water. She is not dead, answers a call, comes out to nurse her baby, to help her children. In most cases her husband discovers her, brings her back to earth or helps her to acquire her human form

a38d.name: The Sun ruins cloak
a38d.description: Because the Sun does damage to a person or animal (spoils, burns his cloak, skin, etc.), the person or animal kills him or catches him in a snare

b106.name: The sky cock
b106.description: When the sky cock cries, all the cocks on earth cry after him, not before

a19a.name: By horse in the morning, by ox in the evening
a19a.description: During its everyday travel across the sky, the Sun changes its draught animals (usually in the morning the Sun rides a slow animal and in the evening a quick one)

j52.name: Two animal persons and their children
j52.description: A strong and aggressive animal person (often a bear) treacherously kills his (or her) companion who is a weaker animal person. The victim's children revenge on the murderer killing his (her) own children

h37b.name: Charge of skunk used to no purpose
h37b.description: Person gives a trickster his power (usually skunk gives his charge) but he squanders it all to see the effect. When a real need comes, the device does not work anymore

e5aa.name: People grew like a grass
e5aa.description: The first people grew or crawled out of the earth like a grass, mushrooms, worms, etc.

m74b.name: Who has eaten up supplies?
m74b.description: Person secretly eats up supplies and pretends that the thief is somebody else. To prove it he puts remains of the food or his body excretions near his sleeping companion.

l7b.name: Chasing gourd vessel by mistake
l7b.description: Instead of chasing a person, a bush spirit, a monster or a dangerous animal follows by mistake a gourd vessel that floats downriver

i110b.name: Orion is mowers
i110b.description: (Belt of) Orion is (three) mowers or agricultural tools related to mowing and harvesting

k138.name: Exchange of bodies (king and his minister)
k138.description: Person gets an ability to enter a dead body and revive it. His own body remains dead for this time. Another person takes it for himself while the first one remains in an animal’s body

m106a.name: “Myself” and “Nobody” in a demon’s house
m106a.description: After doing damage or injury to his antagonist, person lies that his name is so and so. Other demons understand it not as a name but as a common word and it makes them believe that the injured one was the trouble-maker himself

l53.name: Stones into the maw
l53.description: A monstrous animal is killed or neutralized by stones (or pieces of metal, heavy fruits, etc.) thrown into its maw or anus. The stones are usually burning hot

m61a1.name: Person provokes a quarrel between two birds
m61a1.description: To provoke a quarrel between a gull and another bird, person (always a raven) tells each one that the other was insulting him

m8a.name: Birds peck a rock to release prisoners
m8a.description: Birds and sometimes also animals work hard to break from the outside or from the inside a rock, a tree truck, bonds, etc. to release some beings or themselves from confinement in a small enclosure or trap

m85.name: The fox bluffs
m85.description: An animal person (usually a fox or a jackal) threatens to cut down a tree on which mother bird (squirrel) made its nest unless she will throw down one of her nestlings (squirrel children) or eggs. Another bird lets the mother bird know that the predator is unable to realize his threat

f90.name: A tragic incest
f90.description: Brother and sister marry each other. When their children get to know about the incest, they kill their parents, or father kills children, or parents suicide, or wife/sister suicides when her husband/brother has died

b28b.name: Pacification of things
b28b.description: Hero comes to a country where inhabitants are afraid of objects or plants who attack them. He easily overcomes these objects and transforms them in what they are now

b42n.name: Orion is one person
b42n.description: Constellation of Orion or the Belt of Orion is identified with only one male person, usually with a warrior or hunter

k27h.name: A task: to carve a bench
k27h.description: A task: to carve a bench decorated with representa­tion of the head of the father(or mother)-in-law that is always concealed

m11c.name: Gets lard from his body
m11c.description: A male person cuts or roasts his own body to extract meat, lard or blood, cooks it and serves to his guest without injuring himself. Such a food is not considered to be unclean

a15.name: Eclipses: crossing of the paths
a15.description: An eclipse happens when the Sun or the Moon turns to a wrong path or when their paths cross

k27d.name: Ordeal: chamber with dangerous beings
k27d.description: An ordeal: to remain alive in a closed room full of beasts of prey, poisonous or other dangerous creatures

b103.name: Cornel-tree fruits
b103.description: Person (a devil or a bear) thinks that because the Cornus mas tree (European cornel, male cornel) blossoms before all other fruit trees do, it also brings its fruits early. The cornel fruits become ripe very late, so the person is disappointed and gets no fruits

m63.name: Body parts enumerated
m63.description: Before finding a part of the body that is the best for some particular function, other parts are proven or enumerated

l100b.name: Forgotten fiancée
l100b.description: A youth and his bride get to escape from the pursuer. The youth goes to visit his home, leaves his bride behind for a time but forgets her (usually after breaking taboo to kiss or embrace his relations). When the youth is about to marry another woman, the forgotten fiancée reawakens his memory by performing magic actions

b42r.name: The Belt of Orion: one runs after another
b42r.description: Three stars of the Belt of Orion are three persons or animals who pursue each other

i41.name: Rainbow serpent
i41.description: Rainbow is a reptile (usually a snake) or (more rare) a fish, or it is related to snake, to its tongue, breath, or to scorpion's tail

m82.name: Rattles tied to tail
m82.description: An animal person sees that another has something tied to his tail, wants the same tail for himself and has a trouble as a result

k27x1.name: Invisible servant (“Bring don’t know what”)
k27x1.description: Hero receives a difficult task (usually to bring an object or creature that have no particular indications and properties) and comes across an invisible person who is a powerful and well-disposed servant to anybody who becomes his master. The hero is kind with him and the person helps him

m112b.name: Animals build a road
m112b.description: When animals build a rode, the mole or shrew refuses to take part in the work and is punished

k17.name: Ornitomorphic suitor
k17.description: Ornithomorphic hero impregnates a girl magically or imperceptibly for her

k27m.name: Task: to kill an animal of unusual color
k27m.description: A task: to kill an animal of special (often unusual) color or form

k32g.name: Punishment: torn apart by horses
k32g.description: To punish an antagonist, he or she is tied to a horse (camel, bull) or to several horses (camels, etc.) who torn him or her apart

k58.name: Construction of watercourse: a tragic love
k58.description: Person builds a watercourse as a condition of marriage. When the work is fulfilled, the woman breaks her promise. She or her bridegroom usually die

k71.name: Coyote first betrays and then saves his brother
k71.description: Coyote's brother is victorious against numerous enemies as far as Coyote does not break some taboo. Enemies kill the brother. Coyote gets his remains, escapes, revives him

d4o.name: Fire stealer pretends to be wet and cold
d4o.description: To steal fire from its owner, person pretends to be wet or cold and is granted permission to sit near the fireplace. In a proper moment the stealer carries the fire away and brings it to people

h34g.name: One grain porridge
h34g.description: One cereal grain (cob, etc.) is enough to prepare a meal

l60.name: Picked up baby-demon
l60.description: Two or more sisters pick up a baby boy. In their absence he turns into adult man but when they come back they find him again in guise of a baby lying in its cradle

m114a.name: Clothes of stone
m114a.description: Person is suggested to make clothes of stone or iron or to skin a stone

k30a.name: The chief’s wife and vultures
k30a.description: Wife of a chief abandons him with vultures (usually by her own will being untrue to her husband). The chief (Witoto: her own brother) brings her back

i81b.name: Haribda (the origin of tides)
i81b.description: It is tide when a creature belches out the sea water or ousts it with its body and it is ebb when it swallows the water or lets it go back

e26.name: Fished out people
e26.description: Man fishes with a hook. Thrown on the ground, the fish turn into the first humans or into the women. (Stories about fishing of women in human guise not included).

m65b.name: The lost quarry
m65b.description: Person kills game (usually by deception), gets to see how thieves carry it away but is unable to intervene

j46.name: Enemy drowns
j46.description: Antagonist perishes falling into the water or trying to cross a water body

m12.name: The unlucky hunter
m12.description: Not to return home empty-handed, a hunter or (rare) a fisherman cuts off a piece of flesh from his body (usually from his calf) or (more rare) extracts his blood or entrails. Usually he brings his flesh or blood to other people pretending that is a good game or fish; or a woman cuts off a piece of flesh from her calf to feed her husband

b77b.name: Sky touched with a long object
b77b.description: The sky rose to its present height and/or the direct relations of the sky deity with the people were broken off when the sky or the deity was touched or struck with a long object (a pestle, a broom, etc.)

m39a6.name: Misunderstood instructions: to cut a road
m39a6.description: A wayfarer asks his companion in an allegorical for to tell a story. The companion takes his words in the direct sense and acts stupidly

i22.name: Symplegades (obstacle opens and closes)
i22.description: Souls on their way to the land of the dead, heroes or shamans have to go between moving rocks, trees, river banks, etc. which are incessantly meeting and parting

l104.name: Fugitive and pursuer change guises
l104.description: A fugitive turns in succession into different animals or objects. A pursuer does the same, every time becoming an animal or a person who is dangerous for the fugitive in his given guise

k19c.name: Star-wife hidden in a bag
k19c.description: During the day time a man hides his star-wife in a bag, gourd-vessel, and the like

h12.name: Orpheus: visit to the land of the dead
h12.description: Alive person visits the land of the dead, usually following a dead person

c6b.name: The diver is muskrat or beaver
c6b.description: A muskrat, a beaver or a nutria brings the desired object from under the water

g25.name: Cereals spilled over the earth
g25.description: Seeds of cereals have been spilled over the earth, now people cultivate them

l69.name: Puma rescues man from a monster
l69.description: A man is attacked by a monster but puma or jaguar fights with the monster and rescues the man

f85.name: The Moon: contra men and pro women
f85.description: The Moon (female or male) is the leader of women in their struggle against the men or leads the women away from the men

e9j.name: Monkey-wife
e9j.description: Man marries monkey-woman; supernatural woman takes form of a monkey or the man pretends that the house-keeper is a monkey

k89c.name: Helpful brother is married to bear
k89c.description: A girl parts with her brother or sister who marries a bear and helps the girl

l70.name: Fruit falls and kills
l70.description: Person or animal is killed or injured with a heavy object dropped from a tree (or rock, etc.). The person or the animal knows that the objects will fall but has falls ideas about its character and weight

k18c.name: Urinates at his father’s arms
k18c.description: A baby boy has to recognize his father among many men. When his father takes him, the boy urinates at his arms

i101.name: Big Dipper is poles, a nailed skin
i101.description: Several bright stars of Big Dipper or other constellation are poles which support or stretch an object like skin, shelter, etc.

l111.name: Hook from the sky
l111.description: The sky dwellers fish human beings who live on earth with a line and a hook

k27nn.name: Envious minister
k27nn.description: Not the powerful person himself but his official or adviser tries to get rid of the hero and suggests that the person should give the hero difficult tasks

l52.name: Hero escapes from top of a tree
l52.description: Hero hides in a tree from an ogre. Before the ogre gets to fell the tree, the hero flies away or a bird helps him to escape

g20.name: Woman turns into plants
g20.description: Food crops emerge from remains of a woman or girl

m61a2.name: Person provokes a quarrel between two birds
m61a2.description: To provoke a quarrel between two different stones, person (always a raven) tells each one that the other was insulting him

b75c.name: Sounds of the time of creation: a murmur of forest and waves
b75c.description: The murmur of leaves or waves of the time of creation is still heard

b75b.name: Sounds of the time of creation: a creaking of trees
b75b.description: Man pushes his mother-in-law or his wife into a tree hollow, she turns into the creaking of trees or into echo

l37c.name: Bad Luck imprisoned
l37c.description: Misfortune is a particular being who was imprisoned and sticks to a person who has released him

a37b.name: Shooter’s thumb cut off
a37b.description: Small animal (marmot, rabbit, mole, toad, frog) or person who turns into this animal tried to hit the Sun with his arrows but remains without thumb as a result

i45b.name: Not to point at the rainbow
i45b.description: It to point at the rainbow, pointing finger or entire arm will rot, wither or become crooked

l45.name: Duped watchman
l45.description: An ogre or a stronger animal catches a man or a weaker animal or drives him into a small enclosure and goes away for a time leaving a watchman. The hero dupes the watchman, escapes. (Most, though hardly all American cases can have post-Columbian African origin)

k52.name: Rescue from the sea bottom
k52.description: When a woman or a lad comes to the sea bank, she or he is carried away by sea predators (killer-whales, sharks, swordfish). Man descends to the bottom and rescues the woman or lad using his shaman's power

m29a.name: Trickster-raven
m29a.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is raven

a44.name: Moon the protector
a44.description: A woman tyrannized by her husband or an orphan girl or boy asks the Moon to take her or him to the sky. The request is granted and the person is seen now on the lunar disc

l42b.name: Credulous children of ogre
l42b.description: An ogre's child or (rare) wife believes in what hero tells him (or her) and releases him. Usually the hero kills the child and puts its meat to cook in the very pot where the ogre planned to cook the hero

i95.name: The Pleiades are a sieve for grain
i95.description: The Pleiades are a sieve to process agricultural products

m39e.name: What sort of a tree?
m39e.description: Asking about minor details of the case, a judge demonstrates that the plaintiff (or the defendant) lies because he does (not) know about them

i27c.name: The four-eyed dog
i27c.description: Dogs having spots over the eyes are called the four-eyed and believed to have special properties (e.g. to see ghosts)

k73b.name: Innocent woman punished
k73b.description: A woman who was falsely accused of killing her new-born child or giving birth to pups and the like is punished in such a way that she must suffer from filth and be taunted by passers by

i62.name: Milky Way is a river
i62.description: Milky Way is a sky river, water body, chain of beings that swim

l113.name: The ogre bridegroom
l113.description: A girl refuses all suitors, at last marries a handsome man and walks with him to his place. Her husband proves to be a cannibal demon

f2.name: Pregnant limb
f2.description: Child is born from a tumor or swelling on person's body (on thigh, knee, finger, etc.) or is temporarily placed there or child grows from blood that flew out from a cut

m75b2.name: Bird tries to avert predetermined marriage
m75b2.description: When a boy and a girl are still small children, a bird gets to know about their predetermined marriage. All its attempts to prevent the marriage fail.

m14a.name: Roasted alive
m14a.description: To revenge on his wife and her kinsfolk, a man roasts her alive

f48.name: Why women are different
f48.description: Different women are not similar physically because pieces of the first woman's flesh distributed between men were of unequal quality or because males who copulated with her had different nature

b42p.name: Ursa major is a bear
b42p.description: Ursa major is identified with a bear

b46a.name: Stolen star of the Pleiades
b46a.description: The seventh star of the Pleiades was abducted by stars of Big Dipper and now is seen among them

c6f.name: Diving for drowned person
c6f.description: Persons or animals dive to get from under the water a drowned person or creature or part of its body

k60c.name: Touchy with king, patient with stableman
k60c.description: King’s wife is extremely touchy and cannot suffer a slightest pain. She does not say a word, however, when her lover who is a servant or a demon is beating her

d2.name: Woman gives birth to the fire
d2.description: A woman gives birth to a son who is very hot (usually the fire or Sun)

i57.name: Thunder pursues his enemy
i57.description: Thunder's enemies are evil spirits, reptiles, animals living in burrows. They hide from him in different objects, Thunder destroys these objects

f9c.name: Snake in vagina
f9c.description: Snake or (in Polynesia: eel) is in vagina, vagina is a mouth of a snake$ or a woman with toothed vagina is associated with a snake$ or a snake crawls out of woman's mouth to bite a man during the copulation

d1b.name: Male spirit of fire
d1b.description: The fire is personified as an elder man (alone or with his wife, mistress of fire)

l6a.name: Asks to be carried
l6a.description: Person that looks weak and feeble asks a man to carry him or her on his back and refuses to leave him

e9i.name: Swan-wife
e9i.description: Man marries swan- (or goose-, duck-, crane-)woman; supernatural woman takes form of a swan, etc.

l41a.name: Stone in basket
l41a.description: Hero escapes from the demon's basket or bag letting stone instead of him

f71.name: Susan and the old men (the innocent slandered maiden)
f71.description: An innocent girl or young woman rejects a man who attempts to seduce her. The man accuses her of loose conduct, ultimately the truth comes to light

h36ff.name: Death and the raven
h36ff.description: Raven is responsible for introduction of permanent death

k13a.name: Person with cut off leg ascends to the sky
k13a.description: Certain person's leg or (rare) both legs are cut, torn, or bitten off. He ascends to the sky, usually becomes a constellation or a luminary or gets to the luminary

f6.name: Gouged our vagina
f6.description: Woman has no vagina and it is later made by bird or animal

m32a.name: Eating pieces of flesh that fall out
m32a.description: Person's intestines or pieces of flesh from his bottom part fall out. He eats them up taking for a good meat or fat

b23.name: Prohibited fire and smoke
b23.description: God prohibits making fire for cooking and punishes breakers of this taboo

h18a.name: Pup lets animals lose
h18a.description: The owner of game animals conceals them underground. One of the ancestors turns into pup, is adopted by owners' children, lets the animals lose

i2.name: Lightning from eyes
i2.description: Lightning emerges from eyes or mouth of the being who is thought to produce thunderstorms

i95c.name: Orion is a staff
i95c.description: Orion is a staff, a crook

k8f.name: Deer in monster’s belly
k8f.description: A swallowed up person finds alive deer in the belly of the monster

h9a.name: Who will give birth the first
h9a.description: One woman is associated with stone, another with a plant. The plant-woman gives birth the first or the stone-woman do not have children at all. That's because people have their present characteristics (are mortal, capable to speak, etc.), or offsprings of the two women are different (skillful and not, etc.)

m67.name: Trickster gone with a wind
m67.description: Imprudent trickster produces wind that carries him away

m105.name: Make believe killing of mother
m105.description: Person conceals his mother or (rare) wife or mother-in-law, tells another that he has killed or sold her, another really kills or sells his mother (wife, mother-in-law)

k27f.name: Difficult task: to build a bridge
k27f.description: A task-giver asks to build a bridge (usually of gold etc.) during a very short time

k11a.name: Feathers turn into birds
k11a.description: Feathers of giant bird turn into different present day birds

l44a.name: Give me your liver
l44a.description: A man hides in a shelter. An ogre wants him to give certain parts of his body. The man gives the ogre instead parts of the body of a killed animal. The ogre does not understand the deceit, gives in response parts of his own body and dies

l54.name: Lake coming to boil
l54.description: To overcome a disaster, hot stones or ashes are thrown into the water

b17.name: Night in container
b17.description: Darkness is a particular object that can be carried (usually brought from its original owner in a container)

k28.name: Father or uncle is rival and enemy
k28.description: Maternal uncle or father (or grandfather if he replaces father who is not mentioned) of the young man is his rival or enemy and tries to kill him

b91.name: Sharp-eyed snail
b91.description: Snail had (the) sharp(est) eyes. Another animal person borrows them and never returns

e11.name: The burned skin
e11.description: Magic person reveals his true nature and/or remains with the real people after the object responsible for preserving the non-human appearance (usually an animal skin) is destroyed (usually burned)

m123a.name: Three-toed foot
m123a.description: Raven marries or tries to marry a girl pretending to be handsome chief. They notice that somebody is eating carrion. Usually when everybody have to take off there footgear, raven's three-toes feet are exposed. He is driven away or runs away being ashamed

l125.name: Demonic wife recognized
l125.description: A man marries a beauty but catches her in a situation when her not human nature is revealed. After this their marriage breaks down

a23b.name: First beams on the tree tops
a23b.description: Two persons or animals argue who would see the rising sun first. One who looks not to the east but to the opposite direction gets to see the first beams on trees or mountain tops and wins

j44.name: The broken bridge
j44.description: Person or his helper draws his enemies on the unstable bridge and destroys it. The enemies fall into water, into a precipice

i54.name: Water creature full of fish
i54.description: Anaconda or a water monster has live fish or animals inside; is father of the fish; all fish emerge from its body

j19.name: Wicked guest murders woman
j19.description: When husband o brother leaves home to hunt, an evil spirit comes to his wife or sister. The spirit kills her or carries her away after injuring or transforming her

l9a.name: Sharp leg
l9a.description: Person's leg is injured intentionally or by chance. The loss of one leg does not bother him. He uses the sharpened bone as a thrust weapon

m91b.name: Sold ashes
m91b.description: Using trick, a man sells or exchanges for treasure ashes. Another person tries to sell ashes and is ridiculed

b58.name: Wild turkey’s red neck
b58.description: After the original fire is stolen by the ancestors, a partridge size forest bird (Penelope sp.; Anhima cornuta; etc.; jacu, paujil) swallows burning coal and (besides the Andoque) its neck becomes red

m157b.name: To take the one thing she holds dearest
m157b.description: Husband casts his wife out but allows her to take the one thing she holds dearest. She takes her sleeping or drunk husband with her and thus moves him to forgive her

k56a1.name: Mother-in-law helps the girl to fulfill a task
k56a1.description: Coming to powerful man, a girl must make work that she is unable to do. His mother makes the work for her, and she marries the man

l7.name: Chasing an animal by mistake
l7.description: Instead of chasing a person, a bush spirit, a monster or a dangerous animal pursues by mistake an object or animal that moves nearby

l20.name: Eater of the raw meat
l20.description: Two persons hunt or fish. One of them is or becomes a cannibal. He or she reveals his or her nature eating the quarry raw

a2b.name: Extra suns and moons annihilated
a2b.description: Other suns or moons besides present ones had been in the sky and were later annihilated

l85c.name: Half-chicken
l85c.description: Person with half of a body is a chicken (sometimes only by name)

f65d.name: The feigned burial: wife does not believe
f65d.description: A man feigns death and is abandoned at the burial place. His wife (mother, aunt) gets to know about the deceit and provokes the man to show that he is alive

c35a.name: Wise adviser punished
c35a.description: A zoomorphic person gives wise advise concerning the ways that the Sun should follow. His advise is accepted but he himself is punished by the Sun

k123.name: Old woman’s curse
k123.description: A youth or (rare) girl offends an elder woman (often breaks her pot). She makes him or her to be overcome by desire to undertake something dangerous (usually to get a particular marriage partner)

k94.name: Bird of luck (eaten up head)
k94.description: Person eats magic bird, fish, small animal, or fruit and becomes prosperous and powerful

k10a.name: Battle with a bird: a shelter
k10a.description: Heroes kill a dangerous bird. During or before confrontation they hide inside a shelter (hut, cage, vessel, bag, hollow log) or cover themselves with a protective object

k27p1.name: Antagonist in animal guise
k27p1.description: Antagonist asks the hero to kill or to tame a dangerous animal or not to kill certain animal during a hunt. This animal is the antagonist himself (or his daughter or wife)

m132a.name: Ears, not horns
m132a.description: Predator animal believes that an ungulate has dangerous horns and then understands that these are but ears

e29.name: Lizard gives proper hands
e29.description: Two persons (usually Coyote and Lizard) argue if people's hand has to be like a paw or people should have fingers

b1a.name: Three worlds: the universe divided between gods
b1a.description: Anthropomorphic persons agree to divide between them levels of universe (upper world, earth, lower world)

f70.name: Potiphar's wife: false accusation of sexual abuse
f70.description: Woman makes vain overtures to young man and/or falsely accuses him of sexual abuse. Her husband believes that the young man is guilty, kills or tries to kill him

k47b.name: Dog turns into handsome man
k47b.description: A girl marries a handsome man whom she had first seen in guise of a dog

k27l.name: Task: to get object from bottom of body of water
k27l.description: A task: to get an object from the bottom of a water body

l106.name: Lost object claimed back
l106.description: An antagonist makes a demand to the hero which is correct in form but really is unjustified. The hero fulfills the claims or is punished. Now antagonist takes an object or animal possessed by the hero, is unable to give it back and is punished

a12a.name: Eclipses: a predator animal
a12a.description: During an eclipse or at the sunset the Sun or the Moon are attacked by a predator animal (a bear, a feline, a canine, a racoon)

k56c.name: Golden axe
k56c.description: A man loses an axe. A spirit or a powerful official suggests him a golden axe but the man does not accept it. The spirit (official) gives him axes of gold and silver as a reward for his honesty. Usually another man intentionally loses his axe, claims the golden one but receives nothing

a12b.name: Eclipses: a frog or toad
a12b.description: During an eclipse or at the sunset the Sun or the Moon are attacked by a frog or toad

m118a.name: Cave of Ali Baba
m118a.description: Person penetrates into enclosure with valuables after getting know magic words that open the door

k100b.name: A grateful dead
k100b.description: A young man helps to bury a man and / or pays the debts of the dead man lets free a fish or an animal that was caught or he or his father renders a help to somebody. When the young man sets off for a journey, the grateful creature or person in guise of a stranger becomes his companion and protector

c25b.name: A spinner in the Moon
c25b.description: Somewhere outside of our world (in the sky, on the Moon, etc.) certain person is spinning, weaving, plaiting, or embroidering

h17.name: Ring of defenders around chief
h17.description: Ancestors surround their (dead) chief trying to defend him or his corpse. A trickster gets to go through the ring, kills the chief or steals and devours his heart

m7a.name: Left in water
m7a.description: A bird or an animal takes hero into its boat but acquires its animal guise and leaves him alone in water when he breaks a taboo

f83a.name: Indecent proposal made through children
f83a.description: Animal person comes to children of a big predator and tells them that he will copulate with their mother (or that he will beat her)

b108.name: Person turns into snow
b108.description: Anthropomorphic person broken into small particles turns into the snow that shines under the sun

i100d.name: Stars and kids
i100d.description: The Pleiades or stars in general are associated with kids or lambs

a31a.name: The cut off breast
a31a.description: When a woman gets know that her husband or lover did something against accepted rules of behavior, she cuts off her breast and shows it to him

m161.name: A dog in the bag
m161.description: Person gives another (often a fox) a bag putting inside a dog instead of food; or he makes free a girl who was kept in the bag and replaces her with a dog. The dog attacks the one who opened the bag

m74.name: Exchanges vomits
m74.description: Two animals or persons compare their vomits to know about the diet and habits of each other. The weaker one gets to exchange vomits, to swallow the unusual food before, or to swallow his partner's vomits

m29qq.name: Trickster is an anteater
m29qq.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is an anteater

l101.name: Pieces of clothes thrown to pursuer
l101.description: Pursued by demonic creature (usually a whale or walrus), people throw behind piece by piece children’s or woman’s clothes. These attract the pursuer’s attention, he loses time, the runaways escape

i67.name: Rhea and Milky Way
i67.description: Milky Way is a giant rhea

b7c.name: Water splashed out
b7c.description: Person or creature possesses all the fresh water. Another person splashes it out of a container or pond making it available for everybody

k2a.name: Hero marooned in the underworld
k2a.description: A man descends down into the well, precipice, etc. Saving a girl or girls, getting treasure etc. he sends them up. After receiving girls and treasure, companions cut the rope and the hero remains below

e40.name: Nostrils upside
e40.description: First people have noses with nostrils upside and are in trouble when it rains

i87b.name: Boaster in search of a rival
i87b.description: Person boasts how strong he is. His wife tells him that he is not the only strong man. He sets off, meets a person who is much stronger than him

m156.name: The ungrateful one returned to captivity
m156.description: An (animal) person saves a dangerous animal from a snare or the like. The saved one is going to kill his savior but the third person saves the second (usually tricks the first one to captivity again)

l5g.name: Elder sister’s head rolls after her younger sister
l5g.description: Only head remains from a girl. It rolls after her younger sister or sisters or they take it with them. Ultimately the head finds a place to stop

j54.name: One of two female companions kills another
j54.description: Two co-wives of female companions live together, both have children. Once when they go to work outdoors (usually to gather wild plants), one of them kills and devours another. The victim's children escape

l12.name: Vultures and incomplete body
l12.description: Vultures bring to the sky a being who has lost part of its body members or is reduced to the head or skull

m44b.name: Thieves of food: the women
m44b.description: Person discovers that somebody steals game or fish from his trap or devastates his garden. He or his guards catch the thieves who prove to be (the first) women or the thief is the water being whom the hero lets go after receiving a woman for ransom

i38.name: The dog-heads
i38.description: Some beings are half-men and half-dogs (usually anthropomorphic with heads of dogs)

m147.name: The fox runs in front of the tiger
m147.description: The weak animal tells the strong one that all the other are afraid of him, the weak one. To prove it, the weak one walks in front of the strong one and the latter believes that forest dwellers run away seeing not him but the weak one

h37a.name: Jump over brushwood kindles fire
h37a.description: Person gives a trickster ability to kindle fire easily. He uses it without need, it is lost

f55.name: What do you want?
f55.description: A woman cannot understand what does her partner want. She points at, names or suggests different things. At last she points at, names or exposes her genitals. This is the right answer

k134.name: The planted treasure
k134.description: To accuse a guest of theft, a host plants a treasure into his guest’s bag

l71.name: Tip of a branch
l71.description: Person has killed an animal. A trickster attempts to appropriate all the meat. The person gets to carry the meat to the top of a tree and helps the trickster (or trickster's child) to get there too to share their meal. After eating, the trickster wishes to defecate or (rare) to drink. The person points to the tip of a thin branch as a right place for doing it. The trickster climbs there, falls and dies

a2a.name: Several suns burn the earth
a2a.description: The world was (almost) burned when several suns had (will) appear(ed) simultaneously. (Texts with "Moon was equal to Sun" without "the burned earth" motif not mentioned)

g26.name: Swallowed food: saved for people
g26.description: Food products were swallowed or hidden in person's mouth. Thanks to this people got them

b77b2.name: Sky touched with a broom
b77b2.description: The sky rose to its present height and/or the direct relations of the sky deity with the people were broken off when the sky or the deity was pushed up, touched or struck with a broom

l98.name: Cannibal owl
l98.description: Dangerous cannibal or bush spirit who abducts children, attacks people, etc. is associated with an owl

f58.name: Trickster and women
f58.description: A man cohabits with a group of women (or with several women in succession) concealing his identity and/or intentions. He is either eventually exposed and punished by women or escapes to continue his tricks

b33b.name: A bird of march
b33b.description: In the late winter or early spring a bird (usually a thrush) flies out before time and dies of cold or her nestlings die of cold

k14.name: Precious advices
k14.description: A man gives his last money for simple advices. Each of them saves his life or helps to achieve success or he does not follow the advices and gets into trouble

m152.name: Why only one wolf?
m152.description: Deceived by a weak person, a predator animal or an ogre is frightened and runs away. Another animal is eager to explain his mistake and leads him back. The weak one repeats former trick or pretends to be angry: why the animal (ogre) brought to him is lean (small; only one instead of several, etc.). The predator (ogre) again runs away

f99.name: A baby copulates with his mother
f99.description: A baby son turns into an adult man, copulates with his mother, then acquires his baby guise

i82c.name: Venus is the Moon’s wife
i82c.description: Venus or some other bright star seen near the eastern or western horizon is female and wife of the Moon

i17.name: Body anomalies of inhabitants of a distant land
i17.description: A race of anthropomorphic beings without mouth, anus, genitals, whose women do not know how to give birth lives in the underworld, in the sky, in a far-away land

c27.name: A horn in the ice
c27.description: A horned monster breaks ice on river or lake. Usually people walk across frozen body of water, get to see a horn protruding from the ice and try to cut it off. The monster breaks the ice, many people drown

b25.name: Pigs fall from a tree
b25.description: Persons climb a tree or liana and fall turning into wild pigs and other game animals

m64.name: Person pretends to possess resources
m64.description: To get valuables (food, fire) concealed by their owner, person pretends that the valuables are already in his possession

i104.name: Stars are moon’s fragments
i104.description: Stars are fragments of broken Moon or (rare) Sun; or stars, the sun and the moon are formed from one and the same primeval person or creature

l72a.name: Comb becomes a thicket
l72a.description: Running away from a dangerous being, person throws objects that turn into mighty obstacles on the way of the pursuer. One of the thrown objects is a comb which usually turns into a thicket

k73a.name: Baby child substituted with pup
k73a.description: Rivals of the beloved wife hide or throw away her baby and substitute it with an animal (usually with a pup) or object

k66.name: Extraordinary companions
k66.description: Several companions have extraordinary abilities (one who runs fast, one who eats great quantities, one who produces or can withstand severe frost, etc.)

k106.name: Thrown to cows
k106.description: To get rid of a baby child or of the magic cock, they throw him into enclosure for animals, but cows or other animals do not trample the child or cock down

f60.name: Trickster cures maiden
f60.description: A girl gets sick. A man comes to cure her but only copulates with her or makes an attempt to do so

i112.name: The monster boat
i112.description: A boat is a fish, a living creature with a mouth, it can swallow people

k121.name: Wanderer at a crossroad
k121.description: It is written at a crossroad that following one of the paths person will safely return and following another it will not return (there is often a third path following which person either returns or not). Hero follows the dangerous path

g3.name: A rock of crops
g3.description: Cultivated plants or fertile soil to plant them are hidden inside a rock. Birds or Thunders get them destroying the rock

e36.name: Hard covering of the body
e36.description: Human body was protected with a hard layer now preserved only on fingers and toes as nails

i76a.name: Snake turns into dragon
i76a.description: After certain time a snake or fish turn into a dragon

m134b.name: Wolf measured by tailor
m134b.description: When a predator is going to eat a man, the latter asks permission first to measure him and beats with his (feigned) measuring tool

k87b.name: Woman steps into bears’ dung
k87b.description: Gathering berries a woman steps into bear's dung and curses bears. A bear abducts her and marries her. Her human husband, her brothers, or supernatural person kill the bears

h29.name: Origin of foreigners
h29.description: A woman is impregnated by an animal, usually by a snake. People of hostile nation originate or receive their culture from her progeny or from her paramour's relatives

k131a.name: Hero settles an argument of animals
k131a.description: Several animals (often a lion, an eagle, an ant) argue because of an animal carcass or a living place. A man settles their argument, they give him capacity to acquire their form (their qualities)

m180.name: Fox and crane invite each other
m180.description: An animal person invites another and serves his food in such a way that he is unable to taste it. Then the other invites the first animal and puts him in similar situation

b63.name: Transformation of lazy boys
b63.description: Young people, usually siblings, tell other person, usually their mother, that they have been doing agricultural work though it is not the case. When the deceit is discovered, they turn into atmospheric phenomena

b16b.name: Wolverine makes the sea salty
b16b.description: Wolverine or fox bathes in the sea making the water salty

h6d.name: Stolen immortality
h6d.description: Person brings a remedy that gets immortality. While he is asleep, somebody else steals the remedy

m29f.name: Trickster-wolverine
m29f.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is wolverine

k136a.name: Hair picked up from a river
k136a.description: Person finds a hair that was carried by water and decides to marry its owner

b83.name: Too heavy bag
b83.description: Person tries to pick up a small object or creature but it proves to be of enormous size and weight

m90b.name: Sun rises from the West
m90b.description: Person was wrong being sure that the Sun cannot rise from the West

m163.name: The precious cat
m163.description: Person gets to a country where rats or mice are a plague and receives a fortune selling a cat

f79.name: Animal wives
f79.description: Person marries several non-human wives in succession, every time (besides the last one) is disappointed

j22d.name: Two animals from one cut in two
j22d.description: Two halves of one animal cut in two turn into two new animals or into foreigners

b24a.name: Circle of feathers
b24a.description: Person makes a circle of bird feathers around a group of people or throws feathers into their dwelling, people turn into wild pigs

i87.name: Skull as a cave
i87.description: Personages use a shelter which proves to be an object related to the world of the giants (a skull, a shoulder-blade, a mitten)

g1.name: A kidnapped child
g1.description: Valuables (earth, soil, sun, crops, fire, sacred knowledge, hunting luck) are got or returned when son or daughter is stolen from his or her parent

j23.name: A late son kills monsters
j23.description: People disappear one by one. A lonely woman has a baby or finds a baby or she becomes pregnant magically and gives birth to a boy or twins. The boy grows up, exterminates the antagonists, usually revives and releases those who had disappeared

e13a.name: Ritual objects from under the water
e13a.description: People obtain ritual objects from under the water or brings them back to the underwater world

m61a.name: To obtain valuables, quarrel provoked
m61a.description: To obtain valuables person provokes a quarrel between their owners. When the owners become to fight with each other, the valuables fall out

m13.name: God grants requests to his visitors
m13.description: Some persons ask the supreme deity (usually coming to him) to fulfill their demands. The deity does it according to the letter and not to the spirit of the demand

m83b.name: Whose dream is better?
m83b.description: Two (or more) (animal)-persons agree that whichever of them has the most wonderful dream may eat all the food. The first one tells about a feast that he participated in his dream. His companion answers that he was sure that after such a feast (after getting into the paradise, etc.) the first one would not need the food, so he has eaten it alone

d4l.name: Fire from the sky
d4l.description: First fire is sent to earth from the sky or the ancestors ascend to the sky and bring from there fire or warmth

l62.name: Stone man
l62.description: Stone man kills people but ultimately is killed himself

m68.name: Breaking wind scares game
m68.description: Because of his own obstinacy, person suffers of breaking wind permanently and starves because a loud noise produced by him scaring game

h25.name: To choose life or death
h25.description: People are suggested to choose one of two objects, associated with life and death. They choose the object with death

c10a.name: The flood: birds cling to the sky
c10a.description: During the flood some birds survive clinging to the sky with their beaks

h21a.name: Not to kill the big fish
h21a.description: The owner of fish holds it in a container and regularly takes as much as he needs. Another person opens the container breaking the rules and the fish escapes

l107.name: The ear-sleepers
l107.description: Anthropomorphic beings have huge ears (use them for blankets, umbrellas, etc.)

b78.name: Shaking bed makes snowfall
b78.description: When person or creature shakes himself or itself, shakes his or her bed, clothes, plucks birds, etc., snow falls down to earth

b72a.name: Mother, child and swans
b72a.description: (Step)parent does not share his or her food with a child. The child (usually a small girl) asks the migratory birds (swans, geese, etc.) to take her or him with them. The birds give the child feathers (wings, etc.) and the girl (boy) flies away with the birds

a22b.name: Hot fire and cold ashes
a22b.description: Person who becomes the Sun burned up in a hot fire while his companion burned up in the less hot fire or threw himself into the ashes. He (she) turns into the Moon or a star which gives no warmth

k8c1.name: First swallowed by herbivorous animal and then by wolf
k8c1.description: Tiny boy is first swallowed by chance by a big herbivorous animal and then carried away by a wolf who began to eat the animal's offal

i20a.name: The sky giants
i20a.description: Anthropomorphic inhabitants of the upper world are giants

b1.name: Two male creators
b1.description: In the beginning of times two companions or brothers compete in producing things. Usually one of them is or becomes master of the underworld

d7.name: Fire and toad
d7.description: Frog or toad possesses the fire, steals it from original owner, tries to extinguish or to save it

m17.name: Woman lies that man missed
m17.description: A blind man or lad kills an animal. His wife or (grand)mother lies that he has missed, cooks and eats all the meat alone

i8e.name: Four supports of the world
i8e.description: The sky or the earth rests upon four or five (cardinal points and the center) supports of any kind (poles, mountains, giants)

b31.name: Woman turns into water mammal
b31.description: After a conflict with a man or remaining alone, a woman turns into water mammal

k80d.name: The stuck in pin
k80d.description: Person is bewitched (transformed into a bird, faints) when a pin or other sharp object is stuck into her (rare his) body

a20.name: Childhood of the Sun and Moon
a20.description: The Sun and Moon are two siblings who live on earth and then ascend to the sky. Their (birth and) childhood are described

i28.name: Animals in the underworld
i28.description: Game animals live inside a mountain, in a cave or in the underworld where they often look like humans and have a master

k136b.name: Rubies from a river
k136b.description: Person finds precious stones (usually in a river) and gets to know their source

i80a.name: The youngest Thunder
i80a.description: Man meets Thunders and becomes one of them

m162b.name: Sour sap into the bear’s eyes
m162b.description: Person makes believe to rub sour berries into his eyes. Another (always a bear) suggests to rub the same sap into his eyes and is blinded. The person kills him

b42m.name: Second hunter’s cooking pot
b42m.description: Hunter identified with Mizar (the second star of the handle of the Big Dipper) carries a cooking pot identified with Alcor (weak star near Mizar)

l124.name: Sinew of a killed enemy cuts a tree
l124.description: After killing his adversary, person pulls out his sinew (spinal cord, intestine, ribbon of skin) and puts it around a tree trunk. The trunk is cut through. Fortunately for him, the person has not put it around his own waist

m8d.name: Birds break body covering
m8d.description: Birds work hard to peck through the substance that covers some beings' body or to reach its entrails

i10a.name: Colored layers of the sky
i10a.description: Different sky levels or different categories of clouds have different colors

k80b.name: Killed by the stepmother, eaten up by the father,
k80b.description: The (step)mother kills or orders to kill her small (step)son, eats him or feeds his flesh to her husband. The son revives, usually in the form of a bird who tells about the crime.

l31b.name: Reptile carries people into the water
l31b.description: People find a snake or a turtle on a dry ground. They touch it or sit on it, stick to it, it carries them into the water

e31a.name: Creators and rescuers of a girl
e31a.description: Several men take part in creation or reanimation of a girl (rare: a bird) or several women take part in the reanimation of a dead man or they differetly express their grief. It is asked whose role was crucial (who behavior more noble) and/or who should be the spouse of the reanimated person

k10e.name: Rescued people
k10e.description: Getting to a nest of a monstrous bird, a man finds there kidnapped people, helps them to return home

m29o.name: Trickster is a monkey
m29o.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a monkey

i25a.name: Bones to cows
i25a.description: Person sees that food put for certain animals is inedible for them and corrects situation (usually gives to herbivorous animals food that was given before to predators and vice versa)

m106c.name: My name is “The Guest”
m106c.description: Person lies that his name is “The Guest” or so and eats all the food suggested to the guests

j22c.name: The double woman
j22c.description: A demonic creature has a form of two women half merged like Siamese twins

k38b.name: Snake threatens nestlings
k38b.description: A serpent or water monster regularly devours or injures children of powerful being (almost always: nestlings of giant bird). The bird has no power over the serpent but hero kills the monster

h36d.name: Death and the hare
h36d.description: Hare is responsible for introduction of permanent death

b89.name: Owl as a king of birds
b89.description: Owl was or wanted to be king of birds or it behaved itself in a wrong way during the elections of the king. Now it avoids other birds and/or other birds chase it

b13a.name: Stream follows person
b13a.description: A stream of water (with a monster in it) pursues person who tries to escape from it

a35a.name: Dirt into the Moon’s face
a35a.description: Spots on the lunar disc are dirt thrown into the Moon's face by his/her sister/brother or mother

j25a.name: Son of grave
j25a.description: Mother dies or is killed. Her (still unborn) baby-son is buried with her. He comes out of the grace, meets people, then returns to the grave but ultimately agrees to remain with the people

d13d.name: To make hidden woman laugh
d13d.description: Woman is hidden somewhere inside the house. Man makes her laugh to discover her

b43.name: Purusha
b43.description: Parts of the body of the primeval person or creature are transformed into different elements of the landscape and parts of the universe

l57a.name: Hero’s companion gets his body part back
l57a.description: When the hero loses his organ or body part, his companion who is weaker and often irresponsible gets it back. The hero is revived or becomes strong again

b27.name: Variants of transformations
b27.description: Persons ponders over what object, feature, or creature it would be appropriate for him or her to turn into. When the choice is made, the persons transforms himself or herself

k56a2.name: If asked to do in a bad way, do otherwise
k56a2.description: Person (usually a girl) gets to the powerful person (usually an old woman) who asks her to act in a strange and harsh way (to put room in disorder, to bring unclean water, and the like). The person does not according to order but in a rationale and polite way and is recompensed. Another person acts according to the direct sense of the words and is punished

l41b.name: Pitch basket
l41b.description: An ogress puts her victims into a basket which is filled or smeared with pitch

d4p.name: Parrot or parakeet obtains fire
d4p.description: Parrot or parakeet steals fire for people. (Australian data not computed because historically definitely unrelated to the Tropical American data)

k27w.name: Monster brought by the hero kills the task-giver
k27w.description: Task-giver asks to bring him dangerous being or object possessed by a moster or deity. Hero fulfills the task. The beast, monster, deity or the object itself kills the task-giver

m152d.name: Whose voice is louder (the elephant and the tiger)
m152d.description: The elephant and the tiger (lion) make a competition (usually argue whose voice is louder). The tiger wins and is going to eat the elephant. A small trickster animal saves the elephant

a35b.name: To smear the Moon with pitch
a35b.description: To make the Moon less bright, some person tried to smear it with pitch

m123c.name: Unlucky flight with migratory birds
m123c.description: A bird-person who usually does not fly away in the autumn makes attempt to fly with migratory birds but is unable to reach destination

k83.name: The sons on a quest for a wonderful remedy for their father
k83.description: To cure his father (father-in-law, sister) or to make him young again hero must bring a remedy from a distant country. He fulfills the task, the sick person is cured (becomes young)

l116a.name: Doe with golden horns
l116a.description: Hunting a doe (a deer), hero gets to a demon’s place; the does is a bewitched person or demon

m106.name: Meaningful name
m106.description: Person lies that his name is so and so. His enemy, victim or other people, demons or animals understand it not as a name but as a common word and behave accordingly

l64.name: Removable head
l64.description: Person removes part of his or her body (head, scalp, lungs) and then puts it back

m170a.name: Sinful camel and pure wolf
m170a.description: A predator sais that a herbivorous is a great sinner and must be eaten up

b40a.name: Missed opportunity to have horns
b40a.description: Animal who has no horns now had them before or missed opportunity to get them

k59.name: Box for Osiris
k59.description: One man puts another into a box, closes the lid (or ties him to a board, to canoe, etc.) and puts the box adrift. It floats to another land, man is released there, returns home, revenges on his enemy

b10.name: Drunk out water
b10.description: Person drinks a lake or all the water in the world or all the water is originally inside person's belly. When a hole is made in it, the water pours out

k86.name: Weeping child stolen
k86.description: Because a small child is ignored or punished by its parents (usually it cries late in the evening), bush spirit or animal carries it away

a7.name: The sun pursues the moon
a7.description: The Sun and the Moon are persons of different sex. The man pursues the woman or vice versa. Details of pursuit usually explain why the luminaries are not equally bright and/or why there are stains on the lunar disc

f28d.name: Artificial conception
f28d.description: Woman conceives after masturbating with an artificial penis

l42a.name: Ogre steals corpses
l42a.description: An ogre steals fresh corpses from graves and devours them

m29y.name: Trickster is a wren
m29y.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a wren

k27z6.name: The stone of patience
k27z6.description: Being a victim of the injustice and after much suffering a young woman tells about her fate to certain inanimate objects (often it is “the stone of patience”) or her story is told by her husband. The woman is rescued and the justice restored

h28a.name: Mosquitoes from sparks and smoke
h28a.description: A burned person or creature immediately turns into a multitude of mosquitoes or biting flies

l57.name: Person gets his body part back
l57.description: Person loses his organ or body part, it is carried away. He finds its new owner, gets his property back

m134.name: A tower of wolves
m134.description: Animals stand one on another making a tower. When the lowermost moves, the tower collapses

k27z4.name: Trained animal of the gambler
k27z4.description: Person always wins a game thanks to a cat (or a mouse) who carries the lamp (or puts the light out in a certain moment). The hero releases a mouse (or correspondingly a cat), the cat runs after it and the person loses the game

l58.name: Avaricious man
l58.description: A man does not share food with his wife or kinsfolk. He or his food is transformed (turns into a bird, into worms, etc.) in punishment

a5a.name: The Sun created from the Moon’s swaddling clothes
a5a.description: The younger brother (usually the Sun) is created from urine and swaddling clothes of the elder brother (usually the Moon).

l15d.name: The external soul
l15d.description: Life of a person or creature is preserved outside of his (her, its) body. Person or creature dies after the corresponding object is destroyed

d4n.name: Person weeps asking for summer
d4n.description: A boy or (among the Kutenai) a woman weeps, asking for an element that is absent, i.e. for summer, fire, or rain

i27.name: Chthonic canine
i27.description: A dog is the lord, guard or guide of/to the land of the dead; or dogs live on the way to the land of the dead

e34.name: Sacred flutes from ogre’s remains
e34.description: Ogre is killed. Musical instruments used in male rituals and taboo for women emerge from his remains

c12b.name: People descend from a dog
c12b.description: In the beginning of time or after the flood man marries a bitch. Present people descend from them.

m7.name: Waiting to be picked up
m7.description: Getting into the lower or upper world, to an island, a country at the horizon, etc. a man is unable to move further and waits for somebody who could bring him to his destination. Some animals, birds or celestial bodies pass by, the last one (often the Sun or the Moon) picks him up and brings to the place he is eager to go

k127.name: Brothers transform into swans
k127.description: A girl has many (more than three) brothers, they turn into birds or ungulate animals (rare: they are killed by magic), ultimately become human again

k65.name: Genii loci
k65.description: Being thrown out, put into certain places, born by primeval couple some beings turn into spirits of particular loci

k19g.name: Two stars of different color and brightness
k19g.description: Two stars are men, an old and a young ones. They look different as about their color or brightness but these characteristics do not correlate (the bright star can prove to be an old man and vice versa. Usually two girls wish these stars for husbands and express different preferences (one prefers bright blue star, another wants small and red one, etc.)

i70.name: Water reptile on plants on its back
i70.description: Trees or reeds grow on the back of a monstrous reptile

m39a4.name: Fool and his shadow
m39a4.description: Fool takes his own shadow for a person who pursues him and gives it his possessions

h51.name: The demonic horse
h51.description: A horse is associated with antagonist of the God

b42f.name: Ursus major is an ungulate
b42f.description: Ursus major (seven stars or only four stars of a dipper) is identified with an ungulate (elk, deer, mountain sheep, etc.)

i92.name: Rainbow transforms sex
i92.description: Person who gets to walk under, over or through the rainbow changes his or her sex

i35a1.name: Challenge to Thunder-god
i35a1.description: Person pretends to be the sky-god imitating rain and thunderstorm

f49a.name: Animal explains how to give birth
f49a.description: A small animal (mouse, rat, rabbit, opossum, a bird) explains a woman how she can deliver her child in a natural way

m30.name: Trickster falls down
m30.description: Person or creature who has no wings or is unable to fly on a long distance attempts to ascend to the sky or to fly far away but falls down or, deprived of his wings, remains in a place from which he is unable to return

m1b.name: Caiman ferries a monkey
m1b.description: Caiman ferries a monkey across a river. Reaching the opposite bank, the monkey escapes before the caiman gets to catch it

k27t.name: Climbing contest
k27t.description: A contest: to climb a pole or tree

m29h.name: Trickster-owl
m29h.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is owl

l42e.name: Caught again
l42e.description: An ogre catches a person and carries his or her prey home but the person escapes on the way. The ogre comes back, this time carries the person to his home. Or the ogre catches a group of children, most of them escape on the way, one is brought to the ogre's place

k64a.name: Blinded cyclops
k64a.description: Person blinds sleeping ogre and escapes from him

k27u.name: Hide-and-seek
k27u.description: Hero and his adversary play hide-and-seek. The hero finds his adversary but the adversary cannot find him

m180a.name: The unwashed monkey
m180a.description: An animal person invites another but asks him to wash his hands or feet before dinner. This proves to be impossible and the hungry guest goes away

a6.name: The Sun and the Moon are females
a6.description: Both the Sun and the Moon are considered to be females (incl. cases when the gender is not directly specified but both emerge from parts of the body of a female person)

k80a.name: Pipe tells about a murder
k80a.description: An object or a creature that emerged from remains, decorations, etc. of a killed person tells about his or her fate. Usually a reed grows from the person's grave and a pipe made from the reed tells the story

j31.name: Father’s weapon
j31.description: A young hero obtains and uses weapons or other powerful objects which belonged to his murdered father

f22.name: Study of partner’s body
f22.description: Person asks another person of the opposite sex about destination or place of her or his genitals. Usually it is made after putting questions about function of other body parts; or person tries to use for sex different parts of the partner's body or tests them before reaching the best place where the genitals should be put

m81b.name: Not to climb after an arrow stuck in a tree
m81b.description: Despite a warning not to do so, person climbs in a tree to get his arrow that was stuck and gets into trouble

k27v.name: Task: to hit an aim
k27v.description: A task: to hit with an arrow or a stone an animal, a bird, or object (usually placed at the top of a tree or pole)

m136.name: Sickle as an unknown beast
m136.description: Grain is harvested with inappropriate tools. Seeing sickle for the first time, people take it for a dangerous animal

a33.name: The Sun ram
a33.description: The Sun has appearance of one a hoofed animal (bull, ram, pig, etc.)

k27hh.name: To sort grain
k27hh.description: A task-giver asks to sort a large amount or small particles of different kind (usually seeds of different plants) mixed in container or to count such particles or to pick up the spilled grains

i16.name: Body anomalies of the first people
i16.description: First human beings have no mouth, anus or genitals, their women do not know how to give birth

d13g.name: Meet seen on teeth
d13g.description: When person laughs, people see his or her monstrous mouth (many teeth, human meat on teeth). They kill the monster or escape from it

a19b.name: By snail in summer, by bird in winter
a19b.description: For its sky voyage, the Sun chooses draught animals according to the season, riding a slow animal in the summer time and a quick one in the winter time

m28.name: Icarus (failed attempt to fly on artificial wings)
m28.description: Person flies on artificial wings or partly turning himself into a bird but falls to the ground or remains in a far away place being unable to fly any more

h31.name: Origin of death: man and celestial bodies
h31.description: God summons to him man and celestial bodies and makes the man mortal and others immortal

i45c.name: Not to count stars
i45c.description: Person who counts stars will suffer diseases and misfortunes

f52.name: Pubic hair for a bird’s crest
f52.description: A bird person gets his crest putting on his head a pubic hair of a woman or part of her genitals

j12k.name: A valuable partner and an imposter live in one house
j12k.description: A valuable partner whom a girl (two sisters) should marry and an imposter live together in one and the same house

a38c.name: The Sun’s cloak
a38c.description: A boy or a girl has a cloak. The Sun spoils it or gives instead a better one

m153b.name: Wolf rides a horse
m153b.description: Wolf is killed or injured when he accepts a suggestion of the horse (donkey, etc.) to ride it

f89.name: A smart sister
f89.description: Sister and brother live alone. The brother rejects the incest. The sister makes him take her for unknown girl, marries him

b42k.name: Cosmic hunt and the Pleiades
b42k.description: In the cosmic hunt tale either hunters or game is identified with the Pleiades

h41.name: Death and the dog
h41.description: Dog is responsible for people being mortal or imperfect. Usually the antagonist bribes dog with a warm fur and the dog lets him spoil the half-ready human figures

l108b.name: The thin voice
l108b.description: To make himself unrecognizable by the victim, a predator or ogre modifies his throat or tongue mechanically (oils or burns it, asks blacksmith to remake it, etc.)

c22.name: Toad in search of thunder
c22.description: In time of severe drought or the world conflagration birds and animals are sent to bring rain from Thunders who live at the end of the world. Some fail, the last one succeeds. Toad takes important part in the action

m72.name: Hand in animal’s anus
m72.description: Person puts (for different reasons) his or her hand into the anus of a tapir or other herbivorous animals and is unable to extract it back. Animal starts to run and drags the person behind him for a long time

k43a.name: Compassionate person saves fire
k43a.description: People abandon a boy, a girl, brother and sister, a group of children, or a young family without fire and food. A compassionate person conceals hot coals for the outlaws in the abandoned camp

b98.name: Bat between birds and animals
b98.description: Bat becomes outcast among other creatures usually after it makes attempts to join first animals and then birds or vice versa

j50b.name: Father more dead than alive
j50b.description: An attempt to revive the killed father (and uncle) is only partly successful and the revived person is unable to live among the living. The hero decides to abandon him in the other world or to let him die forever

m60b.name: False doctor: a finished off victim
m60b.description: The deceiver who promised to cure a sick or wounded person or animal devours him

k93a.name: Sword of chastity
k93a.description: Sleeping in one bed with a woman, man puts a sharp or thorny object between them as a sign of chastity

m29gg.name: Trickster-hedgehog
m29gg.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is hedgehog

i46b.name: Rainbow predicts future harvest
i46b.description: Intensity of particular colors of rainbow predicts good or bad harvest of particular crops

i4a.name: Thunder in trouble: falls to earth
i4a.description: Thunder falls to earth, cannot return to the sky. Usually a human person helps him to do it

i117.name: Spider ferries from one world to another
i117.description: Spider person raises the hero to the sky, helps him or her to return back to earth or otherwise helps to overcome the borderlines between worlds

m39c.name: Pumpkin sold as a donkey’s egg
m39c.description: A numskull finds or buys an unknown fruit (pumpkin, melon, etc.). He mistakes it for an egg of a donkey (mare. camel, etc.). When he drops it or throws it off he scares a hidden hare (rabbit, fox, mouse, etc.). The fool thinks the fugitive is a young animal hatched from the egg

b97.name: Kingfisher’s necklace
b97.description: Thankful person decorates a bird who lives near water (kingfisher, loon, goose), thence its appearance (crest, beak, feathers)

k33f.name: Basin of honey and basin of oil
k33f.description: Person promises to fill one basin (fountain, dry river-bed, etc.) with honey and another with oil (milk, etc.) if his wish would be granted. He fulfills the promise either really or formally (honey etc. from broken containers is spilled on earth)

l1c2.name: Hided under the hearth
l1c2.description: Pursued by a demon, persons hide their younger brother or sister or children in a pit under the hearth

m178.name: The lying goat
m178.description: A man sends others one after the other to pasture the goat. Back home, the goat always complains it did not get anything to eat. The man angrily sends away or kills his shepherds (who usually are his family members). When he himself pastures the goat he realizes that it lies. He is going to kill the goat, usually skins it, but it escapes

a11b.name: One-eyed luminaries
a11b.description: The Sun or the Moon have only one eye (the Mundurucu: they are blind)

i60.name: Milky Way is a seam in the sky
i60.description: Milky Way is a sky seam, a concealed fissure or crack between two half of the sky vault

m88.name: Involved into dance
m88.description: A man joins a group of dancing women and is killed or injured as a result

m175.name: A dead lion behind the hyena
m175.description: Seeing a dead lion (or other big predator) behind him, the hyena thinks that the lion is alive and runs away in panic

c23.name: Tree eclipses sky-light
c23.description: Growth and falling of giant tree defines the condition of the sky with luminaries on it (tree eclipses the light of the sun, can destroy the sky, tears the sun off the sky, etc.)

m91c1.name: Herd from the river bottom
m91c1.description: Person gets other person’s possessions by trick (or pretends to get it; usually another person is drowned instead of him) and then demonstrates his possessions (usually a herd) and explains that he had received everything at the river bottom. His enemies believe him

e10.name: Pets turn into children
e10.description: A lonely woman or married couple surprises birds or animals who live in their house and take their skins off when nobody looks at them. Birds or animals (usually pups) become children

h34a.name: Controversy over conditions of life
h34a.description: Person has a series of suggestions how to make the world easy for living and free of hard work and death. His companion successively rejects them

m29k.name: Trickster is a turtle, a toad or a frog
m29k.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a turtle (or tortoise), a toad or a frog

k82.name: Evil sister-in-law
k82.description: Wife of a man or wives of a group of brothers envy his (their) sister and tries (try) to destroy her

k61d.name: Hard work made her ugly
k61d.description: Young woman’s bridegroom or husband gets to believe that she is extraordinarily industrious. To conceal the deception, she herself or somebody else makes the man believe that because of hard work women become ugly or change into animals. The man prohibits his wife to work anymore

l4.name: Cannibal husband unmasked
l4.description: A cannibal, demon marries girls in succession and kills them or kills in succession his sons-in-law. The last of potential victims survives, usually after finding remains of those who were killed before

k35.name: False husband
k35.description: Imposter takes appearance of the hero to take his position and/or to marry or to violate a woman

k65c.name: Unwashed children of Eve
k65c.description: A woman gives birth to many children but conceals part of them (rare: all) from God. The concealed children become poor people or non-human beings

m29nn.name: Trickster is a ground squirrel
