m29nn.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is a ground squirrel (Xerux sp.)

f47.name: Pieces of flesh turn to persons
f47.description: The body of the of a living creature (woman or snake) is cut into pieces. Every man gets his piece, new women emerge from them

l33d.name: Hero defeats monstrous rock
l33d.description: Rolling rock kills people, hero destroys it

c31.name: The smart hedgehog
c31.description: A hedgehog proves to be smarter than other animals (life on earth is saved thanks to him, he deceives a dangerous person, etc.)

b3e.name: Earth falls on waters
b3e.description: In the beginning there are only air and water. 1) Person descends from the sky, creates the dry land or a hard support created for her or him grows into the earth. 2) The earth is sent or dropped from the sky, put on the surface of the water. 3) The earth is brought from somewhere (not from the underworld) and put on the water

k99.name: The sold dream
k99.description: A young man or (rare) a girl has a (day-)dream that predicts his or (rare) her future triumph. The dreamer either conceals or reports its contest to his family and in both cases is punished for too high opinion of himself. In the beginning the dreamer sometimes sells his dream to another young man, who becomes the protagonist of the tale. Adventures that follow explain the contest of the dream. The youth becomes rich and happy (e.g. marries heiresses of two kingdoms, that in the dream were symbolized by two suns or a sun and a moon), the girl marries king's son

f76.name: Animals teach to make love
f76.description: People learn to copulate after they see birds, fish or animals doing it

m91c3.name: Hare the messenger
m91c3.description: After warning his wife about the planned trick, person lets free a wild animal or bird asking it to pass a message to his wife. Seeing the same (actually another) animal or bird in his companion’s house another man buys the animal for a lot of money

l1b.name: Bear-woman and her sister
l1b.description: A young woman turns into monstrous bear. She kills most of the people besides her younger sister (Ojibwa: younger sister of her former husband). Their brothers return from a hunt, kill the bear or she dies pursuing them

k60b.name: Invitation to coffin
k60b.description: Person is lured into a trap being invited to lie in a box or a hole to measure it. Being unable to liberate himself from the box etc., the person remains in power of his enemies

e3.name: New people from bones
e3.description: After destruction of previous world, new people (rare: new earth) are made from the bones of the perished race

j15b.name: Woman gets to a toad
j15b.description: Setting off (usually in search of her husband, boyfriend or kinsmen), woman gets to the place of female toad or frog

m111.name: Monkey on the banana tree
m111.description: An animal person who can climb trees (usually a monkey) suggests another (a turtle, a crab) to harvest bananas. He climbs the banana, throws down but peels, rotten fruits and the like. His companion revenges on him

b42q.name: Ursa major is a carriage
b42q.description: Ursa major is identified with a carriage, a cart

b72b.name: Offended one turns into bird
b72b.description: Children do not give water to their thirsty mother or mother (step mother, stepfather) does not give water to thirsty child. The offended one turns into a bird and flies away

g18.name: Person wants to be killed
g18.description: A boy, woman or (more rare) man asks other people to abandon him or her in the forest, to burn or drag her or him on or around the future garden plot, to burn her in her house, etc. A woman usually asks to kill her when she understands that people know her way of producing food which she extracts from her own body. People fulfill person's wish and find cultivated plants on the place

m44c.name: Thieves of food: a young hero
m44c.description: A boy or young man comes to steal food of a person who is elder than he. Usually he is caught but not punished and invited to live with the elder person

k31.name: Wooden seal
k31.description: Person makes a sea mammal or fish of wood, it carries another person or persons into the open sea or kills him or them

b44c.name: Should warmth and light exist?
b44c.description: It is discussed if darkness or light, cold or warm periods should exist

k58a.name: Water for love
k58a.description: Person brings water or a river with fish to the place where a girl agrees to marry him and does not do it if the girl is unwilling

k39.name: Man feeds his own flesh to his animal helper
k39.description: Person has to feed powerful creature (usually a giant bird) giving it regularly pieces of meat. When meat supply is exhausted, he cuts off a piece of his own flesh

m167.name: A tiger taken for a bull
m167.description: During the night a strong predator (a tiger, a lion, etc.) and a thief not knowing about each other get into stable to steal a domestic animal. The thief takes the predator for domestic animal or for a person and acts accordingly

m84b.name: Bones into the water
m84b.description: Butchered and eaten animal, bird or fish revives after its bones are thrown into the water

e31.name: Pygmalion
e31.description: Man makes a wooden doll, makes believe that it is alive. Really it is not or it is half-alive. Usually a real woman takes place of a doll, marries the master

b34.name: Overtaken by the first night
b34.description: When night escapes from container where it was originally preserved, men surprised by the darkness turn into birds or animals

f5.name: Brides for first men
f5.description: Person cannot or do not want to give his daughters in marriage to all the men who claim them for wives and transforms animals into girls. (Usually in the beginning of times or after the flood many men come to marry the only daughter of God or patriarch)

f83.name: News precede man
f83.description: Person commits something shameful, obscene. Presumably, nobody could see him doing it. When he asks people, "What's the news?", they answer that so-and-so (this person) has done such a thing

l9c.name: Sharp breast
l9c.description: Person has a sharp axe-like protrusion on his breast

m189.name: To thread a spiral shell
m189.description: To thread a spiral shell (a stone with tiny opening, a horn, etc.) person ties the thread to an ant and lets it go through the opening

i72.name: Stars are people
i72.description: Stars are people, ghosts, anthropomorphic beings (interpretations of unique star objects like Venus or Polaris as persons not considered)

h9b.name: Children as shoots of plants
h9b.description: People are likened to plants which are mortal but revive in their offsets

m127c.name: Frightened without reason
m127c.description: An animal person mistakes an object abandoned by chance or intentionally for an evidence of a danger and behaves inadequately

i53.name: Insect bothers the world-supporting being
i53.description: The animal or the fish which supports the earth is bothered by an insect. The animal moves and the earth trembles.

l18.name: Multi-headed bird
l18.description: A bird with two or more heads on top of one body is described in tales or represented in art

k73d.name: A younger daughter instead of a son
k73d.description: A man who has only daughters needs a son to fulfill the task fit for men (usually to send a son to a prince who needs a soldier). His daughters in succession disguises themselves as men. The elder are scared by dangers and come back but the younger resolves the task. (In Balkan and Caucasus tales the father meets daughters disguised as a robber or a predator animal). See motif F70E

m109a.name: To sit on the ice waiting for food
m109a.description: An animal suggests another to sit on the ice till some food will fall from the sky. Waiting this way for food to fall down the anima is frozen to the ice

i4b.name: Thunder in trouble: fights with his enemy
i4b.description: A man helps Thunder who fights with his enemy

l33f.name: Goatsucker breaks Rock
l33f.description: Rolling rock pursues person. The person cries for help, and goatsucker breaks Rock to pieces

f23.name: Origin of menses: sexual act
f23.description: Women menstruate because they bled in primeval time after the first defloration

f33.name: Water creature paramour
f33.description: Certain woman or a group of women take for paramour a big water animal (caiman, otter, sea-lion, whale, anaconda; rare: water bird, crab), water spirit or monster. Husbands, brothers or (adoptive) children kill or maim paramour and/or (sometimes) the woman

i46a.name: Old woman’s rainbow
i46a.description: Rainbow is associated with an old woman

k8c.name: Jonah: swallowed by terrestrial animal
k8c.description: Person gets into the belly of ground animal or bird. He kills it from the inside and/or returns to earth by himself (i.e. not extracted by other people)

b22a.name: Lads and tapir
b22a.description: Boys climb a tree to eat fruits. Tapir asks them to give some fruits to him, they refuse to do so. Tapir tries to kill the boys

m133.name: Wind saves situation
m133.description: Cumulative tale: a small bird cuts itself with a sharp blade of grass or a thorn and asks the others to punish the plant. Everyone finds an excuse why they cannot do anything (sheep, wolves, boys, etc.). The last one is the wind, it blows making all other persons act

k8b.name: Woman is soul of a whale
k8b.description: Raven gets inside a whale where he sees a woman who asks him not to touch an inner organ of the whale (usually its heart) or a burning lamp. Raven touches it, woman disappears, the whale dies

m91.name: The killed corpse
m91.description: Person pretends that a person (often his or her mother, spouse or lover) who recently died is alive, claims that the death of the false alive resulted from negligence of others and gets a reward

m117.name: Head under wing
m117.description: Fox or other predator asks a bird what does it do when the wind blows. When the bird demonstrates how it puts its head under its wing, the fox kills it

k107a.name: Iron shoes to be worn out
k107a.description: Wandering to the purpose of her or his travel person has to worn out her or his iron shoes or staff

k107.name: Lost husband found
k107.description: A woman is abandoned by her magic husband. She finds him and becomes his wife again

i59.name: Milky Way is spilled straw
i59.description: Milky Way is a trace of people who spilled on their way something related to agriculture (straw, chaff, hay, more rare flour, peas)

i86.name: Hairs into animals, scales into fish
i86.description: Master of living beings sends down, hairs, scales, etc. which turn into birds, animals, fish

f86.name: Signal for paramour to come out
f86.description: Person summons with a certain signal his or her sexual partner or ward who is of non-human nature. Another person spies, uses the same signal or pronounces the same words, kills those who come to him or uses them sexually himself

f70a.name: Disordered clothes as evidence against innocent man
f70a.description: To accuse a man or boy of (sexual) abbuse, a woman tears her clothes, smears or scratches her body pretending to be attacked

m148.name: Agrees to be eaten up
m148.description: One animal person persuades another to agree to be eaten up, usually promising a reward after the resurrection. The fool agrees and is eaten up

c25c.name: The Bid Dipper and the end of the world
c25c.description: Change in configuration of the stars of certain constellation (usually Big Dipper) or its disappearance from the sky will be a signal of approaching world cataclysm

k33d.name: Donkey’s skin
k33d.description: A man discovers that a beautiful girl hides herself under a guise of an ugly and dirty servant, under a skin of an animal or in an object that is brought into his house

k56e.name: Two humpbacks
k56e.description: Two men have a similar defect (a hump, a lump). One spends a night in a place where spirits free him from his defect. Another comes to the same place but spirits double his defect giving him what they had taken off from the first man

m171b.name: Shoulder-blade with no meat
m171b.description: Person pretends that he has not a bare should-blade but a good piece of meat, asks people to cook it and then blames them for stealing the meat

k29a.name: Survives in a fire
k29a.description: Hero demonstrates his supernatural abilities remaining alive in a burning hot chamber, stove, bonfire, among burning vegetation

m39a2.name: Misunderstood instructions: a sharp object
m39a2.description: Fool is acting in an absurd way taking instructions literally or being one step behind. One of the episodes is related to treatment of a needle or other sharp objects

l33e.name: Presented blanket
l33e.description: Trickster takes a blanket or decorations which are a property of Rock or other seemingly inanimate object (usually the same trickster presented this blanket to Rock before)

m146.name: The wolf in a trap
m146.description: Knowing that food is in a trap or is poisoned, one animal tricks another to take it

c11.name: Father avenges his son
c11.description: Person uses his supernatural powers to destroy a large group of people who have offended or insulted his son

m46c.name: Swallowed conifer-needle
m46c.description: Person turns into conifer-needle, a tiny particle, a small insect. Swallowing it by chance, the woman becomes pregnant and gives birth to a boy

l39.name: Person hides in a tree but descends
l39.description: Person hides in a tree. Dangerous being gets to see him or her, makes him or her descend and takes to his house or den

h33.name: Walking babies
h33.description: Children walked or could walk from the very birth but this ability was lost or never obtained

m19.name: The bait-person
m19.description: Person ties another one (usually a child) to a fishing line to use him as a bait or orders the tied one to catch fish with his hands

b85b.name: Bag of winds
b85b.description: Wind was or is in a particular enclosure (bag, cave, etc.). It was released from it or comes out from time to time

b42d.name: Sky hunters pursue a tapir
b42d.description: In the cosmic hunt tale the game pursued by the hunters is a tapir

f92.name: Homosexual play
f92.description: A male person is tricked into being used sexually by another man

i81a.name: The chthonic crab
i81a.description: A giant crab produces earthquakes or floods, stops or can stop flow of the waters into the chasm

k65b.name: People and spirits
k65b.description: Spirits or unpleasant animals (reptiles, worms, etc.) are (often: concealed from the eyes of God or deformed) children or miscarriages of the same human couple or the same primeval ancestor who produced first human beings

m114b.name: Not clothed and not naked
m114b.description: Person is suggested to make something and simultaneously not to make it (to come clothed and naked, to stand indoors and outdoors, etc.)

a22c.name: Person sacrificed to the Sun
a22c.description: To make the Sun rise above the horizon, to send him to the right distance from the earth, to make him move across the sky, etc. a person has to be sacrificed

b42b.name: Sky hunters pursue an ungulate
b42b.description: In the cosmic hunt tale the game pursued by the hunters is an ungulate (elk, deer, mountain sheep, etc.)

c6e.name: The diver is a crustacean
c6e.description: A crustacean brings the earth from the bottom of the ocean or from the lower world

m10.name: A girl and a honey
m10.description: A girl or a woman who was stuck in a tree-hollow when she tried to extract honey or who was greedily sucking honey otherwise, dies or turns into the honey or into the bee

k62a.name: Quarrel of mouse and bird
k62a.description: The war between animals and birds begins because a mouse (rat, mole, etc.) and a small bird cannot divide supplies for winter

l21.name: Cannibal’s attention diverted
l21.description: A cannibal under a tree plans to eat up a man who has climbed the tree. The man throws down and afar his pray or some object and escapes while the cannibal rushes to this object or is eating the pray

i118.name: Helpful spider-woman
i118.description: Spider-woman (rare: spider-man) is a patron of the hero who lives in her house and marries her daughter

m91c4.name: Pot that does not need fire to cook
m91c4.description: Man takes a pot from the fire but it is still boiling or he cooks the food beforehand and tells that his pot cooks it in no time. Another man buys the pot

i109.name: Milky Way is the path of the Sun
i109.description: Milky Way is the path of the Sun and/or Moon

b39.name: Narrow waist of an insect
b39.description: Insect-person knows the source of food (cultivated plants) and water but does not share his knowledge. To make him speak, ancestors tie a rope around his waist and pull it till the waist becomes narrow (origin of narrow place between breast and belly of insects)

k40.name: One laughs, another weeps
k40.description: Hero sees two persons or creatures one of which laughs and another cries. The one who cries will be eaten by monster today and the one who laughs he will be eaten tomorrow. The hero kills the monster

g30.name: Chopped penis turns into plants
g30.description: A cut off long penis turns into many edible plants

k135.name: Seven with one stroke
k135.description: A weak and timid man or boy overcomes accidentally powerful enemies and gets high esteem

l89.name: One secretly feeds another
l89.description: Person transforms humans into monsters or animals secretly putting prohibited meat, grease or eggs into their food or provoking them to use a particular object

h7.name: The personified Death
h7.description: Death (alone or with Old Age, Disease, etc.) is a particular personage not identical with the Master of the Dead. Death comes and kills people

j22a.name: Two men from one
j22a.description: Two men or a man and a woman appear from two halves of the cut in two anthropomorphic body or embryo; or another man appears from part of the body of the first one or from his body discharge

f27.name: Girls and the water spirits
f27.description: For girls and young women it is dangerous to come near water. Water creatures swallow them or drag away; a girl can die or become pregnant from a spirit; she can trigger a flood (rare: other cataclysm). Water spirits can come themselves to a girl who has her periods

h46a.name: The dog and the spike
h46a.description: Properties of the cereals (usually the size of the spike) are defined by what the dog did in time of creation

l10.name: Sharp tail
l10.description: A monster kills victims with his or her sharp or stinging tail or protrusion on his or her back

l37a.name: To get know causes of problems
l37a.description: On his way to a powerful person (God), a man comes across some persons or animals who ask him to put questions to this person from their part too (usually to ask what is the reason of their troubles)

k8d.name: Jonah: swallowed by anthropomorphic being
k8d.description: Person (often an animal-person) gets into the belly of anthropomorphic being. He kills it from the inside and/or returns to earth by himself (i.e. not extracted by other people)

k25b.name: Woman pursues a porcupine and gets to the sky
k25b.description: Pursuing a porcupine, woman climbs a tree and gets to the upper world

l49.name: Body parts falling down
l49.description: Body parts of a person or pieces pf his flesh are thrown down successively. Usually, thows who are on the ground take them for game, honey, fish

m130.name: Fox and bird in one hole
m130.description: Fox and bird hide from a hunter together in one and the same hole. The bird makes believe he is dead and escapes (with the fox or alone)

i24.name: A snake bridge
i24.description: Snake, lizard or worm is a bridge or a rope over the river

l67.name: Monster’s hair gnawed off
l67.description: After digging a tunnel under a lying monstrous animal, a small animal (usually a mouse) bites off the monster's hair at a certain place. Hero kills the monster thrusting his spear or arrow through the hairless place into the monster's heart

l22.name: The sound sleep
l22.description: After breaking some taboo, coming across a strange object or person, people fall asleep. They do not feel when at night spirits come and injure or kill them

k102b.name: To ride for the last time
k102b.description: A boy or a girl asks permission to ride for the last time his or her favorite animal; then he or she rides away saving his or her life

f51a.name: Aggressive sister
f51a.description: When incest relations with her brother come to light, the sister openly claims her brother for a husband, turns into monster, kills people

f30a.name: Worm-baby
f30a.description: Woman is nursing a worm, caterpillar or reptile as her baby. People kill the monster

c9a.name: The flood: people turn into toads
c9a.description: During a flood or when crossing a river those people who drown (or those who survive) turn into toads

f100.name: Test of chastity (a queen and a servant girl)
f100.description: A magic medicine demonstrates that the only chaste woman is a servant girl, orphan, etc. King chooses the chaste one

k15a.name: Substituted weapon
k15a.description: Hero substitutes powerful person's weapon with a fake

k65a.name: Spirits fall from the sky
k65a.description: Being thrown down (usually from the sky), some beings get to different places and turn into spirits or animals with particular functions and names

a22.name: To the sky from a bonfire
a22.description: After getting into the fire or boiling water, one or two persons ascend to the sky and turn into the Sun and/or Moon

m29c.name: Trickster-skunk
m29c.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is skunk

l91.name: Long serpent
l91.description: Two or four boys go to war or are on their way home. A long serpent-like creature blocks the passage, they cannot find a path around it and burn it through. One eats its roasted meat and turns into serpent himself or dies

b20.name: Expedition to the upper world
b20.description: People regularly ascend to the sky for hunting, fishing or gathering; do not give honey, fish or proper meat to the old person remained below; she or he makes their return impossible, they remain in the sky

b102.name: Clouds from smoke
b102.description: Clouds are formed from smoke that ascends from the earth

a4.name: Female sun
a4.description: The Sun is female, the Moon is male or (much more rare) also female

k143.name: Hero is a bird-catcher
k143.description: Protagonist of the story is a bird-catcher or a son of a bird-catcher

k19f.name: Stars help to work
k19f.description: Star person or persons descend to earth to work at the garden plot

l17a.name: Eyes on a back of the head
l17a.description: Person or creature has another pair of eyes (or one eye) on the back of his (her, its) head

l31a.name: Children carried away to the sky
l31a.description: An object descends from the sky. Playing children climb on it or stick to it, it carries them away to the sky

e18.name: Snakes and containers
e18.description: People learn how to decorate ceramics or baskets (usually learn decorated patterns) thanks to a water creature

k54.name: Two giants
k54.description: A man meets a dangerous giant (or serpent) who proves to be friendly to him. When another giant fights with the first one, the man helps his friend

g14.name: Swallowed man returns with plants
g14.description: A man is swallowed by a water monster and comes out from its belly in the land of the supernatural beings. He receives from them cultivated plants and brings them to people

j11.name: Unborn child asks to pick up some flowers
j11.description: A quarrel between a mother and her sons in her womb flares up after they ask her to pick up flowers or fruits (usually the insect bites her when she picks flowers up)

c28.name: Unconsidered promise
c28.description: A demon obtains valuables essential for another person's (and for all the people) survival but is tricked to return the valuables

b73.name: The cuchoo: different legs
b73.description: Person turns into the cuckoo so quickly that one of his or her legs remains bare or one of her braids not plaited. Now it is believed that the cuckoo has different legs or wings

e1b.name: Person of unfit materials
e1b.description: Certain person is made of improper material and proves to be short-lived or unfit for fulfilling his functions

k35c.name: Ogre in a well
k35c.description: An ogre (a dragon) kills everybody who comes to him. The hero is not killed but receives a reward because he greeted the ogre and/or gave a correct answer to his question

i106.name: Ursa major is a person
i106.description: Ursa major is only one anthropomorphic being, not several persons

h33a.name: Babies thrown across a hedge
h33a.description: A woman did not allow God to throw her baby across a hedge, roof, etc. Because of this babies lost or never got ability to walk from the very birth

m145.name: The lion in a well
m145.description: A weak animal person demonstrates a strong one his reflection in water. The latter believes that an animal like he contests his supremacy, invites him for a visit, etc., usually jumps in and drowns

k38a.name: White and black rams
k38a.description: Getting to the underworld, hero should take a white ram (horse) which would carry him back to earth. By chance, he takes the black one which carries him even deeper to the lower level of the underworld

m107.name: Turtle bites penis off
m107.description: A smaller animal kills or maims a big mammal (jaguar, tapir) seizing him by his penis

a10.name: The sun finds its eyes
a10.description: The sun gets his bright eye or eyes from an animal

f36.name: Sons kill paramour
f36.description: The (adoptive) children or grandchildren and not person's spouse or brother kill the paramour of their (step)mother or father

j17.name: Frogs in hair
j17.description: Instead of lice, there are other (bigger or dangerous) creatures in the hair of some persons or he or she pretends that his or her hair is infested with them

i84.name: Milky Way is a snow-shoes track
i84.description: Milky Way is a path of a person who was walking on snow-shoes

f70b.name: Revenge of a rejected woman
f70b.description: A woman revenges on a man who rejected her love

g12.name: Tree is a person
g12.description: A giant tree (often with water inside it or with different cultivated plants on its branches) grows out of the human body or is transformed person

m84c.name: Guest of bush spirits
m84c.description: A man spends a night in a forest under a tree. He listens how a bush spirit explains to another that he has a guest (i.e. this same man) tonight

k27n.name: Tasks of the in-laws
k27n.description: Father or other kinsmen of hero's wife or bride try to kill or test him and/or suggest him difficult tasks

m51.name: Meat in a tree
m51.description: One of two animal-persons kills game, another claims it for himself. The weaker one deceives the stronger, carries the meat to a high tree or rock, throws down something inedible instead of meat. Usually this object is sharp or heavy, the stronger one is killed or injured. In some variants meat is carried to a tree not by the person who originally got it but by one who tried to appropriate it)

m181.name: Two companions go to a feast
m181.description: Two animal persons are invited to a feast. Both along the way and at the place of destination one deceives another

l55.name: Monster killed with hot liquid
l55.description: To kill a dangerous animal or monster, acrid or hot liquid (boiling water, resin, soup, etc.) is poured into one of his body orifices

k76a.name: Son the frog.
k76a.description: An (adoptive) son is a frog. He marries a princess, turns into handsome man.

l41.name: Hero escapes on the way
l41.description: An ogre or ogress catches a person and carries his or her prey home but the person escapes on the way or immediately after reaching the ogre's house

m39a1.name: Misunderstood instructions: a step behind
m39a1.description: Fool follows instructions that were reasonable in every previous episode but become absurd in every next one

i13a.name: The horned serpent
i13a.description: Giant water-chthonic or sky serpent or dragon has horns or antlers on its head

m45a.name: Old man and animals
m45a.description: A man falls asleep or pretends to be sleeping or dead. Animals take him for dead: mourn, carry to bury, are going to eat up, etc. The man kills a lot of animals or obtain valuables otherwise

h1b.name: Death of a neighbor’s child
h1b.description: Person does something that results in originating of death because death of some alive being deer to another person is indifferent or desirable for him or her

f98.name: God and a cow
f98.description: Anthropomorphic god descends from the sky and copulates with a cow

k108.name: A revived wife betrays her husband
k108.description: Wife dies, husband revives her, she abandons him for another man and is punished

j63.name: Son saves, daughter betrays
j63.description: Enemies attack household. The master's wife agrees to live with the enemies' leader, her former husband lies outdoors alive but tied up. His daughter refuses to release him, but his son does it. The man kills the enemies, usually cruelly kills his wife and daughter

b42o.name: Broken back constellation
b42o.description: Certain constellation is a male person whose back is broken or wounded

f19.name: Dangerous frog paramour
f19.description: After copulation with a frog, man's penis is injured

k130.name: Is me the most beautiful?
k130.description: A woman asks if she is the most beautiful among female folk and always receives a positive answer. She tries to get rid of her rival when the answer becomes a negative one

j45.name: The stretched out leg (crane bridge)
j45.description: Person stretches his or her leg or neck as a bridge across water body. The fugitives or those who walk ahead cross the bridge; the persecutor or those who are behind usually fall because the person takes his bridge off

b42.name: Cosmic hunt
b42.description: Certain stars or constellations are interpreted as hunters, their dogs and game which the hunters pursue

j25.name: Babies escape and return
j25.description: Heroes (one, two, one of the two), usually beings still babies or embryos, escape into the water, are carried away into the wilderness or thrown into the water. They are caught (often with difficulty) by some persons or come to them by their own will

m39a4a.name: Selling a cow to a lizard (Money inside the statue)
m39a4a.description: Fool sells (gives) goods to an animal or a plant and believes that the buyer will pay or he makes a work which nobody asked him to do mistaking an animal for a master. When he comes for the money, he beats the animal or a plant (follows the animal) and finds treasure

k76d.name: Son the hedgehog
k76d.description: An (adoptive) son is a hedgehog. He marries a princess, turns into handsome man.

m198a.name: Who did steal the ruby?
m198a.description: Judge tells a story to persons suspected of a crime and finds who is guilty watching their reaction

k10f.name: Nestlings turn into eagles
k10f.description: Hero transforms nestlings or monster bird into common eagles or owls

i23.name: Snapping door
i23.description: The door of a house is opening and closing by itself crashing persons who attempt to come in or out

k57.name: Cinderella
k57.description: A girl who conceals her beauty and/or is poor and oppressed by her stepmother puts on a splendid attire and comes incognito to a feast where a man of high status falls in love with her. He marries her after identifying her by an object given to her or lost by her or (rare) seeing how she changes her clothes

k100d.name: Helpful animal becomes a prince
k100d.description: Helpful animal (horse, lion, etc.) asks the hero to kill him and becomes a prince who was this way disenchanted

k21.name: Woman descends from the sky by rope
k21.description: A sky-dweller marries a woman. Being eager to return to the earth, she secretly climbs down to earth by a rope

c33a.name: Blacksmiths restore the chain
c33a.description: A strong man is enchained but his chains become ever thinner. When blacksmiths beat their hammers against the anvils the chain becomes thick again

m78a.name: Tail-boy
m78a.description: A wee boy is a transformed tail of a sheep or goat

c7.name: The flood: breaking the dam
c7.description: In the beginning of times or after the flood a dam of earth, person or creature does not let water to recede. The dam is broken or opened, waters withdraw

l7a.name: Sticking demon: first to person and then to animal
l7a.description: A demon who sticks to other creatures and refuses to get down sticks first to a person and then to an animal or first to an animal and then to a bird

h36g.name: Muddled message: how many meals a day
h36g.description: God sends his messenger to tell people that they should eat only rarely (once in three days or the like). The messenger tells them that they should eat often (three times a day)

l121.name: A hunter’s secret
l121.description: An animal or ogress turns into woman and marries a hunter to destroy him. Accompanying him to the wilderness, she acquires her real guise, the hunter has narrow escape. Usually the wife asks him what are his usual transformations in case of а danger. The hunter's father or mother stops him before he tells his wife about his last transformation

j59a.name: Flight after arrow
j59a.description: Shooting and arrow, person flies on it, after it or ahead of it

b86.name: Babylonian tower
b86.description: To reach the sky, people build a ladder or tower that consists of separate modules (bricks, logs, sticks, etc.). This construction collapses

l86.name: Woman pursues her children
l86.description: A woman turns into demon and pursues her children

e38b.name: People from gourd
e38b.description: After the world cataclysm or in the beginning of times a gourd survives or appears, new people come out of it

i4d.name: Thunder’s instrument stolen
i4d.description: Thunder’s instrument is stolen from him. He or his helper comes unrecognized to the thief, gets his instrument and kills the enemies

k32a.name: Husband goes away for a moment
k32a.description: Man travels with his wife. The imposter replaces her when her husband goes away for a short time

b44a.name: Council on seasons: units of time
b44a.description: The number of discrete units of time in a certain calendar period of time is discussed

h24e.name: To choose life or death
h24e.description: People are suggested to choose one of two objects, associated with life and death. They choose the object with death

g13a.name: People ate dirt
g13a.description: Before acquisition of cultivated plants people ate dirt, mud or stones

a40.name: The Sun or Moon marry toad
a40.description: Frog or Toad is a wife of the Sun or Moon

l114b.name: To bring ogre’s property
l114b.description: Getting a task or by his own initiative, person several times comes o the ogre and steals in succession objects he needs

e2.name: People made for a test
e2.description: Making people, creator does not reach perfection immediately. First variants of creation are rejected, then proper form and material found

m89.name: Melted wax
m89.description: Person dies or is humiliated after some object that he or she made of wax, resin, excrements and/or took for something worthy are melted down

h52.name: The search of immortality
h52.description: Person sets off in search of the country where there is no death. He finds it. He decides to visit his home and dies there

j33a.name: Old woman beats the dummy
j33a.description: A youth or two siblings live in a house of an old woman. they kill her a person or animal who is her husband and make a dummy of him. The old woman is angry that her husband does not answer her, beats him and understands that it is a dummy

b66.name: Rope turns into creepers
b66.description: Persons climb to the sky up a rope or an arrow ladder; fallen down rope turns into forest vines

j36.name: Turtle as antagonist
j36.description: Hero's parents are killed by turtle who pulled them under the water

j8.name: Feathers at the crossroad
j8.description: A woman or a girl is in search of her husband or other person. Bird feathers at the cross-road or near the person's dwelling mark the correct or the wrong way

f43b.name: Women disappear under the ground
f43b.description: When women of the ancestral community abandon the men, they disappear in the opening that leads underground

a12e.name: Eclipses: spider
a12e.description: A spider produces the lunar eclipses

k51.name: The deceived wife
k51.description: A Man disappears or goes away for long time. His wife sets off, comes to a house where her husband lives now or first sends her son there. She gets to know that he has married another woman

i22a.name: Rising and falling sky
i22a.description: The sky is constantly moving up and down in respect to earth

m120c.name: Shared children
m120c.description: Two animals agree to care for their children together. The stronger one devours the children of the weaker one and pretends to be angry when the latter asks whose were the lost children

m94.name: Sliding downhill
m94.description: Person tricks another to slide down a hill knowing that sharp poles, etc. or an open water are below

i34.name: The dangerous tree
i34.description: It is necessary to approach a tree which is surrounded with fire, ejects fire, shoots sharp splints, etc.

m130a.name: Bird helps animal to escape from snare
m130a.description: A predator animal lures a herbivorous animal into the hunter's trap and hopes to feast on its entrails. A bird advices the herbivorous animal to sham dead and helps him to escape

k27b.name: Ordeal: to smoke a pipe
k27b.description: An ordeal: to smoke a huge or poisonous pipe or to remain alive in poisonous smoke

m39a3.name: Had your daughter horns?
m39a3.description: Fool kills a person, throws the body into a pond or a well. His relation throws there a dead goat. Searching for the corpse in the pond, the fool asks if the killed person had horns, etc. People see that he is really crazy and do not suspect him of a crime

m194.name: Traveler’s possessions divided
m194.description: Several animals get objects possessed by a person. Dividing their booty, one animal takes all the food for himself giving the others objects that can be used only by people. Animals that received them suffer or die

k63.name: Hunting wild people
k63.description: A man gets to a country which inhabitants hunts of fish people whom they consider wild and equivalent to the real game or fish

m62d.name: Hare in rotten hide
m62d.description: Trickster puts on a rotten hide of an animal and, being unrecognized, pretends to be victim of hare’s magic. Animals are frightened and decide not to pay the hare back for his tricks

k38e2.name: The packed kingdom
k38e2.description: Coming back from the underworld, abducted princess puts objects that she used there (clothes, house, “kingdom”) into a small container (an egg, a ball, etc.) and brings them with her

i35.name: Dragging a hide produces thunder
i35.description: Thunder is produced by dragging behind a dry animal skin or (rare) a person (rare) or by shaking clothes

l51.name: Victims thrown to water creatures
l51.description: A cannibal, a bush spirit or a dangerous animal throws his victims into the precipice where water creatures devour them

i32.name: Tree of the babies
i32.description: There is (or was) a tree on which souls of still unborn babies grow, which leaves transform into people, or which trunk is covered with female breasts or flowers that innumerable babies are sucking

f28c.name: Bear penis in hands of old woman
f28c.description: Woman masturbates with penis of a big animal killed by her husband or grandson

a8.name: The Sun, the Moon and the Star are three siblings
a8.description: The Sun, the Moon and the star (stars) are three sisters or three brothers

a42.name: Phaethon: false Sun fails to fulfill his duty
a42.description: Person comes to the sun, attempts to fulfill the sun's duty but intentionally or because of a lack of skill does it wrong and the earth suffers from heat etc.

m35.name: Cold enduring competition
m35.description: Two animal persons compete to see who could withstand cold all the night. At dawn one is dead

b14.name: Tears turn into water
b14.description: Rivers, fountains, ocean, waters of flood, rain, etc. emerge from somebody's tears

i6.name: Weather birds
i6.description: A man gets to the nest of giant birds. When the birds come, they bring with them clouds, rain, hail, etc. Usually, nestlings tell the man what kind of weather their father or mother brings

l79.name: Two co-wives, human and monstrous
l79.description: A girl marries a powerful benevolent man. His first wife is a monster. The man kills her or is glad that she is killed by his human wife

m34.name: Thrown object turns into tail
m34.description: An object thrown into person becomes his tail and the person himself an animal

k33c.name: Girl from a fruit
k33c.description: Young man gets a girl who is inside a fruit or a flower

k56a5.name: Old woman becomes a young beauty
k56a5.description: An old or ugly woman is transformed into a young beauty. Usually another old woman tries to imitate her but dies or suffers a reverse

h36e.name: Death and the rat
h36e.description: Rat is responsible for introduction of permanent death

k38d.name: Monster blocks waters
k38d.description: A monster blocks sources of water and usually gives some in exchange for human victims or valuables. Hero kills the monster

m182.name: The tarbaby
m182.description: To catch a thief, a deceiver, the owner of property puts a sticky figure to which the thief sticks (usually mistaken it for alive being and usually touching it with all his body members in succession)

f28b.name: Penis of wax
f28b.description: Certain woman masturbates with a penis made of wax, gourd, wood, radish, etc. Usually her husband or male relative smears it with chile; the woman is hurt or killed

m81a.name: Blind duck-women cured
m81a.description: A man meets two blind women, makes them see, they are or become birds (geese, ducks, grouses or the like)

b96.name: Pursuer turns into surgeon
b96.description: Pursuing heroes, a monster falls into water, turns into a big fish or a water mammal

k27n1.name: Task-giver is a king or a chief
k27n1.description: Person who gives difficult tasks to the hero is a prominent figure in social hierarchy, i.e. a head of political unit of community- or higher level and not a mythical being

b48b.name: Human flesh in the animals
b48b.description: Some game animals have a piece of human flesh in their body that remained since the time when these animals were anthropomorphic

k1e.name: Marooned on islet
k1e.description: Person is marooned on an islet or on another side of a sea or wide river

m38b.name: Stupid wives imitate magic one
m38b.description: A rejected wife acts using magic. Other wives try to imitate her and perish

f43c.name: Bat-husbands
f43c.description: Marriage partners of the primeval women, the amazons or a solitary woman are small animals (usually flying foxes)

m171a.name: Exchange: gets a bride
m171a.description: Person or animal gets to exchange less valuable goods for ever more valuable and ultimately gets a bride

k113.name: Frog-princess
k113.description: Several young men (usually three brothers) find wives (usually shooting arrows or throwing objects on the off-chance). The wife of the youngest initially is ugly or non-human (a frog, a snake) but proves to be beautiful enchantress. She and her husband triumph

k37.name: To recognize his own among several identical ones
k37.description: To return or to get his or her son, wife, husband, domestic animal or (rare) object, person must recognize her, him or it among several identical persons, animals or objects

m104.name: Make believe killing of kinsfolk
m104.description: Person conceals his or her close relatives (children, mother, brothers) and tells another that he or she has killed them. Another believes and agrees to kill his or her own children, mother, etc.

m20.name: Trickster’s jaw injured
m20.description: Person steals bait or fish from fishhooks. His bill or jaw is ripped off or otherwise injured. Usually the trickster gets the ripped off jaw back

i132.name: Climbing a deer antlers up to the sky
i132.description: A giant deer’s or deer-like creature’s antlers reach the upper world, a person climbs them to get there

b105.name: Daughter-in-law turns into hoopoe
b105.description: Father-in-law gets to see his daughter-in-law when she combs or washes her hair. She is ashamed and turns into the hoopoe (origin of hoopoe)

f82a.name: What owl cries about
f82a.description: To lure prohibited sexual partner into his or her hammock, person imitates or interpretes in a certain way voices of birds and animals

m170.name: Pilgrimage of the animals
m170.description: Animal person pretends to confess his sins and become vegetarian, kills those who believed him

m119.name: Demonstrated many times
m119.description: Trickster suggests to be a nurse or a shepherd, kills and eats children or animals, demonstrates to the parent (the owner) one and the same child or animal as many times as was their number in the beginning

i3.name: Weapons of Thunder
i3.description: The lightning (and thunder) is (produced with) an object (axe, sword, mirror, belt, stones, skin, etc.) in hands of anthropomorphic being

h1c.name: Stamped down grave
h1c.description: People do not come back to life (or do not come anymore to their relatives after death) when somebody buries the dead in a grave or stamps down the earth on the grave

k27ll.name: Water covered with ice
k27ll.description: When hero dives, the antagonist covers the water surface with ice or net

h55a.name: A married couple under one blanket
h55a.description: Person gets to see husband and wife who pull their blanket from each other or have not enough space for two on their bed

m89a.name: Horns of hyena
m89a.description: Only horned animals are invited to a feast. Hyena makes itself false horns but is disguised

b59.name: A groups of dancers ascend to the sky
b59.description: A group of people (usually children, brothers or sisters) play, dance, ascend to the sky and turn into Pleiades or other compact constellation

j62.name: The enchanted people
j62.description: An antagonist transforms his victims into stones or (rare) plants, animals, monsters. Hero escapes transformation, revives the victims

k96.name: Fifty sons
k96.description: Many brothers marry or have to marry in such a way that all their wives are (were) sisters

d4g.name: Hummingbird obtains fire
d4g.description: Hummingbird steals for people, discovers or spreads the fire

k144.name: The predestined death because of an animal
k144.description: A certain animal or (rare) man is predicted to become a cause of death of a certain person. When this animal (man) is already dead himself or itself or is faraway, its (his) remains or image becomes the cause of the person’s death

i5.name: Thunder is an animal
i5.description: Thunder looks like a quadruped mammal (pig, buffalo, camel, anteater, tapir, dog, cat, leopard, monkey, etc.)

g16.name: Ants find cultivated plants
g16.description: Ants are the first who find cultivated plants (corn or manioc) which are concealed from the others in particular place

j12c.name: Meeting at a feast
j12c.description: A girl gets to see her bridegroom for the first time at a feast and then sets off to his place following instructions received from him

l116.name: Singing girl in a bag
l116.description: A cannibal (old man, Gipsy, etc.) carries away a girl. He walks from village to village forcing her sing or dance. People recognize her (or her voice) and release her

h19.name: Raven tries to starve people
h19.description: Raven hides or scares game animals preventing hunters to kill them. People outwit him

c1.name: Reversal of cosmic levels
c1.description: The present earth or the underworld is the former sky that has fallen down, or the earth turned in the past upside down, or the layers of the universe collapsed in the past one after another, or they will change their place during the future cataclysm

l78.name: Toad-jaguar
l78.description: Mixed traits of toad and jaguar in iconography; a toad or frog transforms into a jaguar; a toad or frog is a jaguar's mother or wife

f49.name: The abnormal birth
f49.description: Cesarean operation upon a woman at childbirth as a custom

a39.name: The twelve months
a39.description: Every one of the months of a year is a separate object or creature

f9b.name: Piranha in vagina
f9b.description: Biting piranha is in woman's genitals

j60.name: Two-fold impregnation
j60.description: A woman is impregnated by two different males and gives birth to twin sons who have different fathers

b74.name: The red-eyed wood-grouse
b74.description: Eyes of wood-grouse became red because it shed tears

f51b.name: Following thread
f51b.description: To get know the nature or locality of a person, another fastens a thread to his body and follows it

e8.name: People of wood
e8.description: The first people or (the first) woman (wife of a primeval ancestor) are made of wood

l105.name: Invisible missile
l105.description: Animal, fish or person wounded by hero runs or swims away, usually with the man's projectile in his or her body. Local doctors are not able to cure the wound (usually because they do not see the projectile). The hero or his companion comes to the place where the wounded one lives and cures him or her (usually extracting his projectile from the wound)

k76.name: A strange son
k76.description: A boy or (rare) a girl born in family or found by his adoptive parents has strange guise (ball of meat, nut, bag, half of a man, an animal). He or she possesses magic power and usually marries a princess (a prince)

h34h.name: Firewood come by themselves
h34h.description: Firewood, brushwood arrived to the house themselves, no work was needed to cut and carry them

f70c.name: The castrated youth becomes a man again
f70c.description: A young man falls victim of an intrigue and is mutilated (usually castrated). His members are restored by magic, he marries happily

i37d.name: Mushrooms are excrements
i37d.description: Mushrooms are excrements of mythological person

g9a.name: Restored forest and flood
g9a.description: A man fells trees to clear ground for a garden. Certain person or animal revives vegetation and after being surprised by the man, warns him about the coming flood, tells to prepare a boat

f40b.name: A man in a village of women
f40b.description: A man gets into the village of women. Usually he has to satisfy every woman against his will or every woman claims him for herself

j42.name: Waters split apart
j42.description: When person comes to the water body, waters are split apart so the person reaches the other bank walking on the dry ground

i98b.name: The Pleiades are a duck’s nest
i98b.description: The Pleiades are wild ducks, a nest or eggs of a wild duck

m139.name: The released birds
m139.description: Fox catches birds, puts them into a bag and goes away for a moment. Another animal-person opens the bag and puts thorns instead of the birds

h5.name: People and snakes
h5.description: Reptiles or invertebrates are contrasted with men as immortal with mortals and/or are responsible for originating of death; or a snake's bite inflicts the first death

m74a.name: Strange names of the babies
m74a.description: An animal person pretends to be invited to be godfather or he gives names to different places along which he travels in a sledge, boat, etc. The names look strange but become understandable when other people or animals get to know that their companion has devoured all the supplies

i126.name: Ursa major is a stretcher or grave
i126.description: Ursa major is funeral stretcher or a grave

k1g.name: Antagonist charged by stag
k1g.description: Hero turns into stag or creates a stag to charge his kinsman who sent hi into a trap

i10b.name: Colored layers of the earth
i10b.description: Particular layers or categories of the earth have different colors

k25.name: Woman from sky-world marries mortal man
k25.description: A man gets a woman connected with the upper world (bird-maiden, sky fairy, star-woman, etc.), she becomes his wife or (rare) adopted daughter

h44.name: Sky and Earth divide their children
h44.description: Two persons, one of whom is connected with the sky or the water and another with the earth, divide their child or people created by them. Sky or Water takes the imperishable part, and Earth, the perishable

k47d.name: Dog fulfills conditions of marriage
k47d.description: A girl marries a dog because only the dog fulfilled the condition of marriage put by the girl's father

e16.name: Paddles edgewise
e16.description: Riding in canoe, people first turn paddles edgewise, then learn the correct way to use them

f9d.name: Scorpions in vagina
f9d.description: There are dangerous insects in woman's genitals

l59a.name: Stuck to a whale
l59a.description: People who treated badly the hero or his son are pulled into the sea and turn into sea animal or into parts of its body or into parasites on its hide

m29l.name: Trickster is an opossum
m29l.description: In episodes related to deception, absurd, obscene or anti-social behavior the protagonist is an opossum

a31.name: The incestuous Moon
a31.description: As a result of some intimate contacts and/or love affair, the Moon acquires its present appearance (often, the stains on his face) and/or ascends to the sky

g8f.name: Chips destroyed
g8f.description: A deep notch in the tree is magically restored when persons or creatures who cut it go away to take a rest. They get to fell the tree after they begin to burn the cut off chips or to carry them far way

m91c2.name: Put into bag
m91c2.description: Person is put into a bag (a cage, tied up, etc.) to be drowned, burned, etc. He pretends to be in this situation by his own will or because he refuses to marry a princess, to become a chief and the like. Another person is willing to take his place and is killed

b64a.name: Small bones: war between fish and birds
b64a.description: Fish and birds shoot arrows into each other. Since then there are many small bones inside the fish

k1h.name: Imprisoned in the tree-hollow
k1h.description: Person is imprisoned in a tree-hollow or inside a rock and is released by somebody who makes a hole from outside

m75d.name: Vulture’s knife
m75d.description: A man bereaves vultures of their hunting weapons or amulets

j12b.name: Honey-suitor
j12b.description: A suitor or husband is a fragrant Honey person or skillful honey-gatherer

i75.name: World ages
i75.description: Before present world, several (three or more) other worlds or races of people existed

b94a.name: Tree grants a wish
b94a.description: When a man has felled a tree or is going to cut it, the tree or a bird who lived in the trunk grants the man’s wishes

l15h.name: The external soul: three or more objects one inside the other
l15h.description: A small object that contains the life (soul) of a person is inside two or more creatures or other objects (like an egg in a duck, a duck in a hare, etc.) or the zoomorphic soul container tries to escape turning in succession to other animals – three or more enclosures or transformations

k54a.name: Cut tendons
k54a.description: A man and a friendly giant live together. The friendly giant fights with another one and asks the man for help. This help proves to be crucial because the man badly injures a foot of another giant

l15c.name: Hero lies and remains unharmed
l15c.description: Antagonist asks hero what he is afraid most of all (i.e. what object is mortally dangerous for him). The hero lies and the object used by the antagonist does him no harm at all

m160.name: Feelings wounded by deed and by word
m160.description: A strong predator animal and a man become friends. The animal hears how the man or his wife complains about him (e.g. criticizes the bad smell of his mouth) and asks the man to strike him with an axe, knife and the like. Later he comes to demonstrate his healed wound and explains that the physical wound can be healed unlike the psychological one

i46.name: Rainbow belt
i46.description: Rainbow is the ornamented part of the clothes, its decoration, a belt

m182a.name: Captured wild animals ransom themselves
m182a.description: Person smears with pitch a domestic animal (or a figure of an animal, some object); wild animals stick to it one after another; are released for a promise of gifts

j28a.name: Truth about father
j28a.description: Hero asks how one of his parents died and receives a series of false answers. Usually he successively exposes himself to the same dangers, survives and thus demonstrates that truth is still concealed from him

m83a.name: Fox cries for his dead children
m83a.description: Persons or animals argue who of them is older, some claim that they lived in such and such time, but the last one says that he remembers this day because a certain event had taken place at this time

a32g.name: Holding a bush
a32g.description: Person who had been carried up to the moon took hold of a bush or a small tree and is seen now on the lunar disc together with this bush

k24a.name: Supernatural male hides clothes of human girl
k24a.description: Supernatural male person (often a snake, a dragon) hides clothes of a human girl or sits on it. To return her clothes she had to become his wife

b87b.name: A harnessed wolf
b87b.description: The handle of the Big Dipper is not straight because a wolf or a bear (identified with Alcor or with the last star of the handle, η) attacked an ox that was dragging a cart

e1d.name: Canoes of clay
e1d.description: First canoes were made of unfit materials

g23.name: Alive being turns into many objects
g23.description: Person or creature is transformed. Separate parts of its (his, her) body give origin to different objects or creatures

k25c.name: Baby under a tussock
k25c.description: Digging roots or gathering sea food on a beach, a woman finds baby-boy. Usually her mother warns her not to dig a certain bulb or not to do it in a certain way. Breaking taboo, the woman finds or conceives baby-boy

b16a.name: Sea from the urine
b16a.description: Initially there is no sea, it is produced from some person's urine

b2a.name: The female earth
b2a.description: The earth is a female being or associated with a woman

h24d.name: Still picks up what was let lose
h24d.description: Animal person who let lose the content of a container entrusted to him or her (darkness, insects, reptiles, etc.) still tries to pick up what was let lose (etiology of behavior of certain animal species)

b4.name: The fished out earth
b4.description: Islands or continent are fished out of the ocean or pulled to their present place by rope

j12j.name: Imposter is a buffoon
j12j.description: In village where valuable marriage-partner lives an imposter plays the role of a buffoon

k32c.name: True wife turns into owl
k32c.description: When the imposter takes place of the real wife, the latter turns into owl

m179.name: A house of bark and a house of ice
m179.description: Two animal persons live nearby, the house of one of them is destroyed, he asks another to let him in and usually drives the host out of his house. Strong animals are afraid of the intruder but a weak or small one succeeds to return the house to its original owner

j27.name: Lodge-boy and Thrown-away
j27.description: One of two small boys (or one of two pairs of boys, two of three boys) lives in a lodge with his (adoptive) father or mother. The young male who lives in the lodge can be also a pup (allegedly) born by the woman. Another boy (or couple of boys) has been thrown away or born by his mother after her death, grows up by himself or is grown up by some spirit, comes to his brother(s) and ultimately to his (adoptive) parent. Usually (adoptive) father or mother catches him and domesticates with much difficulty

k132.name: Invincible chicken
k132.description: Person of a small size (often a chicken) overcomes powerful adversary despite all attempts to destroy him thanks to objects and animals met on the way and preserved in his bag or inside his body

c13.name: The objects’ revolt
c13.description: During or before the world cataclysm (deluge, darkness) or (Suruí) in particular place at night, household objects and/or stones, trees, domestic animals turn into wild beasts and monsters

m134a.name: Blowing the house in
m134a.description: Predator animal/ogre blows and destroys a fragile house but cannot destroy a strong one. Usually two or three weak personages build three houses only one of which is strong enough.

f63.name: Trickster poses as woman and marries man
f63.description: A male person turns into woman and marries a man. He is either unmasked or abandons his "husband" by his own will

d4e.name: Coyote or fox obtain fire
d4e.description: Coyote or fox bring people the fire, the daylight or the Sun

m11a.name: Fish extracted from body
m11a.description: Person serves people fish extracted from her or his own body

m18a.name: Getting arrows
m18a.description: Person turns into a fish or game and exposes himself as a target. A lot of arrows, darts or harpoons stick in his body making him no harm, he carries them away

b65.name: Intestines turn into creepers
b65.description: Person plays imitating other animal person. His belly is cut open as a result and intestines turn into vines

i45a.name: Not to point at the Moon or a star
i45a.description: Person who points at the Moon or a star or looks intently at them will get sick or die or his pointing finger will rot or wither

b88.name: Job
b88.description: All person's children die. He or she addresses God and asks him why he or she suffers so much

b6.name: First man and woman meets each other
b6.description: The first or the only survived man and woman walk or run to each other around a post, a hill, etc. When they come together they marry each other

m191.name: Cat and wild animals
m191.description: The fox (who married the cat) poses him as a strong and dangerous animal. The wild animals are eager to get him round but are scared and run away

f70e.name: A girl turns into a man
f70e.description: A girl poses as a man, her sex is magically transformed and the man is happily married

m75b.name: Hero inside carcass
m75b.description: A man hides in a skin or carcass of a big animal. A bird carries it to its nest without knowing that the man is inside

m149b.name: Dogs inside
m149b.description: A man tells that there are dangerous animals inside him (or in a box he has) that can come out. A predator who was going to eat the man up (or to bite him) believes him and runs away

m164.name: All tracks going into the den and none coming out
m164.description: Animal person refuses to enter the den of a strong predator seeing that all tracks go into it but none come out

k18a.name: Infant takes father’s bow and arrows
k18a.description: When a small boy has to recognize his father among many men, he comes to him and takes father's bow and arrows

i87a2.name: What is Two?
i87a2.description: Antagonist names numbers from one to seven or nine, every time asking what it is. The hero gives answers that the antagonist accepts as correct ones.

a30.name: The Moon eats the dead
a30.description: Moon descends to earth to eat children, corpses or bones of the dead

k29c.name: Brings tree that was fallen on him
k29c.description: To kill a strong man, others fell a tree and hope that the man will be crashed when it falls on him, or they tie him to a tree. The man remains unharmed and brings the tree home

b37.name: Color of birds
b37.description: Person paints two or more different birds (rare: fish) or they paint each other, smear themselves with paint, decorate their bodies with pieces of bright skin or fabric. Since then feathers, beaks and feet of the birds (skin and scales of fish) are of different colors

m138.name: Human and animal life spans are readjusted
m138.description: God originally gives 20 or 30 years to everybody. Some animals refuse some of their years because of their sufferings. Man wants to have more years and takes them from the animals

i87ab.name: Only child was able to pick it up
i87ab.description: Strong men or a lot of people cannot move the corpse of a killed person or creature but a child or a woman does it easily

f35.name: Paramour mutilated
f35.description: Person (usually a woman, rarely a man) has a monster or animal paramour or married woman has human lover. Legal marriage partner or close relative kills or maims paramour and serves his or her meat to the person (usually husband or brother serves paramour's penis to his wife or sister)

d5a.name: Fire in woman’s genitals
d5a.description: First fire was hidden in genitals or anus of a woman

l33a.name: Rock pursues stealer
l33a.description: Trickster takes off an object (often a blanket) that lies on or near a rock or other seemingly inanimate object and that has been presented to it. The object pursues or otherwise punishes the stealer

m123d.name: Raven the filth-eater
m123d.description: Raven is going to marry a girl but is rejected after they see that he eats filth

j54a.name: The calf and the tiger cub
j54a.description: Two women (usually female animal persons) live together, both have children, one of them kills and devours another. The son of the murderer kills his mother and becomes a companion of the victim's son, or the victim’s and the murderer’s children escape together

e7.name: Person stuck in a cosmic hole
e7.description: To descend from the sky, ascend from the underworld or come out of the cave, people must pass through narrow hole. A person is stuck in the hole blocking forever communication between different parts of the universe

c33.name: Prometeus (the chained strong man)
c33.description: A strong man who ventured to confront God is for a long time (for eternity) chained to a mountain or to a post

j33.name: The dummy
j33.description: A youth or two siblings live in a house of an old man or woman. To produce a reaction from this older person, they kill a person or animal and stuff its skin with insects, worms, ashes, grass or blow it up

j35.name: Helpful tree-frog
j35.description: A tree-frog kills or neutralizes dangerous person or creature who chases heroes

i89.name: The lost caravan
i89.description: At night travelers mistake some bright star for Morning Star, set off, take a wrong direction, perish or get into trouble

m124.name: A bull’s tail
m124.description: Person buries a tail or head of a bull or other domestic animal with a tail or horns outside. He explains that the animal sank into the ground and usually asks the others to pull the tail (horns). When they are “torn off”, he tells that people are guilty of the animal being lost

m38c.name: Old people forged into young ones
m38c.description: In forgery person forges old people into the young ones. A smith who has no supernatural power unsuccessfully tries to imitate him

k46.name: Woman throws herself into the ocean
k46.description: Giving way to a burst of horror or shame, woman or girl runs to the ocean, throws herself into the water or remains on the beach. Her husband or suitor pursues but cannot catch her

e27.name: People from drops of blood
e27.description: People emerge from drops of blood that fall from the sky

l17b.name: Two faces
l17b.description: Person or creature has another face (another mouth) on the back of his (her, its) head

k47c.name: Origin of dogs
k47c.description: A woman marries a dog, gives birth to the ancestors of present dogs who are people's helpers and friends

a5.name: The Sun and the Moon are males
a5.description: The Moon is male, the Sun is also male or (much more rare) asexual

l42d.name: Ogre’s tongue frozen to ice
l42d.description: Person escapes from an ogre, runs over frozen water body and spills some blood on ice. The ogre rushes to lick the blood, his tongue freezes to ice. Or the ogre slips on ice, falls, is badly hurt, dies

k38b2.name: Birds carries hero to its place, hero kills the monster
k38b2.description: Bird carries a man to its place where he kills a monster who regularly devoured the nestlings

k81.name: The handless girl
k81.description: For minor offence or because of a false accusation a man maims (rare: kills) a girl or young woman and drives her out of his house or (rare) the girl maims herself. The maimed person magically obtains her body integrity (the dead revives) and is happily married

i47a.name: Rainbow is fox’s wedding
i47a.description: Rainbow is associated with a wedding of foxes or jackals

a9.name: The moon defends people
a9.description: Female moon does not permit her husband or son to destroy people

i55.name: Stars are openings
i55.description: Stars are openings in the firmament; holes in dwelling's covering are thought to be stars

l80.name: A drop of blood
l80.description: A demonic person or animal is killed but revives or can revive if a small piece of its flesh or blood goes out of control

l103.name: Obstacle flight (Atalanta type)
l103.description: Treasure, or the like, is thrown back to tempt pursuer to delay

h36j.name: Death and the lark
h36j.description: Lark is responsible for introduction of permanent death

m154A.name: A donkey induces overworked ox to feign sickness
m154A.description: One of domestic animals induces another who is overworked to feign sickness. When the next day he must do the work of the “sick” one, he persuades him to stop being ill

k116.name: Woman who never laughs (a wife)
k116.description: A woman never laughs. To make her laugh a man commits something that ruins him

m114.name: Rope of sand
m114.description: Person is suggested to twist a rope or make other object of sand, ash, smoke, etc.

j58b.name: The sky door
j58b.description: Chain of arrows is used to pull or push the sky or the Sun lower or higher or to break a hole in the sky

j22b.name: Two women from one
j22b.description: A woman is torn or cut in half, two new women appear

d4j.name: Rabbit obtains fire
d4j.description: Fire owner, stealer, or stealer's companion is a rabbit, a hare or (among the Ofaie) a guinea pig

i87a.name: Series of creatures ever greater in size
i87a.description: Personage of gigantic dimensions in respect to normal humans and animals proves to be tiny dwarf in respect to another personage

l28.name: Snake-eater
l28.description: Person who have eaten a prohibited meat or fish turns into monstrous snake or fish

i108.name: The Pleiades are a person
i108.description: The Pleiades are only one anthropomorphic being, not several persons

k12a.name: A strained  bow
k12a.description: An unrecognized hero comes to a place where his bride or wife has to marry another man or is tuned into a slave. Despite expectations, he gets to strain a tight bow killing his rivals

m140.name: The theft of fish
m140.description: Trickster pretends to be dead or sick and is picked up by those who carry something edible in a cart (sledge, boat, bag). The trickster secretly eats the food, often after throwing it out of the cart (sledge)

b49.name: Muddled request
b49.description: Animals of particular species do not hear well the instructions concerning their way of life or the ask God for some benefit but muddle their request. Thanks to this they acquire their present habits. (In the Toraja tale the motif is used to explain the mortal nature of human beings)

f1.name: First woman is a transformed man
f1.description: Woman or female supernatural is created by changing the sex of a man

f95.name: Wife of one of two brothers
f95.description: Two companions or brothers live together. One has a wife which he conceals. Another suspects her existence, destroys her or tries to get a wife also for himself

i64a.name: Race along Milky Way
i64a.description: Milky Way is a trace of two (rare: more) animals that were running a race

d12a.name: Heat of the sun is enough for cooking
d12a.description: To cook their food, people use heat of the sun because they live close to its origin

k56a7.name: Strawberries under the snow
k56a7.description: In the winter time a girl (rare: a boy) is sent to bring something that is available only in summer. She brings it

k125.name: House utensil betrays its master
k125.description: An enemy asks house utensils or personal objects where their master hid himself or herself or what direction he or she ran away. One of the objects, not treated by the master in a proper way, betrays him or her

k100a.name: Tobias
k100a.description: A young man lets free a fish or an animal that was caught or he or his father renders a help to somebody. When the young man sets off for a journey, the grateful creature or person in guise of a stranger becomes his companion and protector

h56.name: The prohibited fruit (origin of death)
h56.description: After eating certain fruit, berry, tuber, etc. people become mortal (cf. motif F97: people become sexually aware)

k1i.name: Tree to descend from a rock
k1i.description: A tree or vine quickly grows up near the rock or in the bottom of a pit where the hero was marooned. He gets to the ground climbing down (or up) this tree (vine)

c6c.name: The diver is a bird
c6c.description: An aquatic bird brings the desired object from under the water

b73a.name: The cuchoo: in search of lost horse
b73a.description: A girl (with her brother; two small brothers) is (are) in search of the horse or cattle or the girl is in search of her lost brother. She (alone or with her brother; both brothers) turns into a bird (usually a cuckoo; or both siblings turn into birds) that cries in specific way

f68.name: Death feigned: woman dresses up as a man
f68.description: A woman pretends to die or really dies. Her (former) paramour comes to her grave. She revives and goes with him. Not to be recognized, she dresses up as a man

i83.name: The sky of vultures
i83.description: Birds, first of all vultures and eagles, live in the sky, usually at one or more layers of the upper world

m1a.name: Caiman ferries the Pleiades-brothers
m1a.description: Caiman ferries a person or a group of brothers who later turn the Pleiades

b33c.name: The borrowed days
b33c.description: When the winter ends and the spring begins certain mother (usually March) borrows several days from a neighbor month to preserve its strength and produce a short period of a very cold weather

k93.name: Twin brothers and a woman
k93.description: A twin brother or the best friend follows hero's trace and spends a night in his wife's house but rejects to have sex with her

k32e.name: Ones of gold, of silver, of wood
k32e.description: Negative person or place is contrasted with one or two positive ones as wood with silver and gold

m157.name: My father is giving birth
m157.description: Person proves the absurdity of the claims of another person claiming in response something equally absurd. One or the both say that a man or a male animal had given birth (or is menstruating) or that a female gave birth to a young of another species or that a woman gave birth to an animal

m112a.name: Turtle catches the thief
m112a.description: Animal are guarding some food or water or come after water. The deceiver takes what he needs or does not let the others to use the water. Turtle, toad or frog proves to be smarter than the deceived and catches him

g31.name: Trees tied up with a rope
g31.description: To clear a garden plot, persons put a rope around many trees, pull it, all the trees fall

f87.name: Transformed children of serpent’s wife
f87.description: A girl marries snake, comes with her children to visit her relation. Her close kin (father, mother, brother) tries to get know from her children how their mother calls her husband. A girl tells the secret, mother (father, etc.) of the woman calls the snake with the same signal, kills him. Seeing  her husband dead, the woman transforms her children (and herself) into birds or trees

b18.name: Day in container
b18.description: Day light (also warmth, the sun, the moon) is kept as a particular object in a container, under a cover, etc.

l27a.name: One is eaten up, another escapes
l27a.description: Two or three children get to the house of a demon or the latter comes to their house. They do not know that the person is a cannibal or are not sure about it. The demon eats up one of the children. Another child (children) escapes, the demon pursues him or them and perishes. Usually the demon is a female, and if he is male, his victims do not arouse in him sexual interest

k27x.name: Former husband of magic wife
k27x.description: A man marries a non-human woman. In her world, she has another husband or suitor. She returns to her world, human husband follows her. He stands tests and/or fights with local inhabitants, gets his wife back

k27ss.name: To overcome an old woman
k27ss.description: A mighty man has to wrestle or race with an old woman who proves to be very strong

m199.name: Squeezing the (supposed) stone
m199.description: A man or a weak animal and an ogre (giant, devil) have a contest to see which of them  can squeeze a stone. The man squeezes a cheese (egg, turnip) and thus intimidates the ogre

k56.name: (Kind and unkind girls
k56.description: A girl or a woman meets powerful person, behaves herself in a right way and is successful. Another (or two others) behaves in a wrong way and suffers a reverse (is punished or not rewarded). Rare: the protagonists are a stepchild and a family child of different sex

m59a.name: Porcupine waiting for ferryman
m59a.description: Porcupine asks other animal to ferry him across river, rejects different places to sit, occupies a place where he can easily kill the animal after crossing the river and really kills him

m40.name: The distorted instructions
m40.description: A weaker (animal) person comes to a wife or a son of a stronger one and tells her or him that her (him) husband or father has ordered to give him food, to make love to him, etc.

d13i.name: Broken tooth
d13i.description: Person knows that the deceiver and trickster has one of his teeth broken. To identify him, person makes others laugh and thus open their mouths

b28c.name: Lice grasp a man and pull him into the sea
b28c.description: Lice grasp a man and pull him into the sea

k69.name: A visit to God
k69.description: A group of persons decide to go to the end of the world to meet the Sun or other supreme god. One (or several) of them perish on their way, some reach destination, at least one returns home using the shorter way than the one they have took before

a38.name: The Sun caught in snare
a38.description: Person prepares a snare, loop, noose, etc. to catch the Sun and/or the Sun is caught in a snare, tied by a rope, etc.

m4.name: A wrong step
m4.description: Crossing a body of water or descending a tree, person steps on an certain part of a body of an animal or on a certain animal that have made a chain (usually despite warning that he should not do it) and falls down or drowns as a result

h20a.name: Mistress of fish loses it
h20a.description: A woman (a girl, several women) keeps all the fish for herself. Man comes and lets fish escape into rivers or sea.

h46.name: The dog’s part
h46.description: To punish people, God deprives them of bread but keeps a small part for a dog or other domestic animal. That’s because cereals still exist
